0.title: You got BMW within 1 year, I can't buy 2nd hand Porsche?: Ashneer to BharatPe CEO
0.article_body: Ashneer Grover on Sunday in a tweet responded to the claims of his "lavish lifestyle", including owning a Porsche car. "I am proud Suhail Sameer (BharatPe's CEO) that within 1 year of joining BharatPe you could buy BMW Z4 convertible sports car," Ashneer tweeted. He added, "Ironic that you believe...as Founder (I) can't even afford a 2nd hand Porsche. Touché!!"

1.title: UK govt offers ₹35,000/month to residents to house Ukrainian refugees
1.article_body: Britain will pay its citizens £350 (around ₹35,000) per month if they offer Ukrainian refugees a spare room or property for a minimum period of six months. The government said the new scheme called "Homes for Ukraine" will allow refugees to come to Britain even if they don't have family ties. Notably, about 2 million people have already fled Ukraine.

2.title: 38 held from fake Gurugram call centre for extortion on pretext of loan recovery
2.article_body: Police busted a fake call centre in Gurugram's Sector 20 and arrested 38 people. The accused used to allegedly extort money from loan borrowers by threatening to send their morphed photos and videos to friends and relatives on pretext of recovering the loan amount. Police claimed the accused extorted nearly ₹2 crore till date. They called around 700 people regularly.

3.title: PM Modi chairs high-level meeting on India's security preparedness
3.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday chaired a high-level meeting to review India's security preparedness and the prevailing global scenario in the context of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. Union Ministers Rajnath Singh, S Jaishankar and Nirmala Sitharaman were seen taking part in the meeting with PM Modi. NSA Ajit Doval and Foreign Secretary Harsh V Shringla also attended the meeting.

4.title: Wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted: Jatin Sarna on battling depression
4.article_body: 'Sacred Games' actor Jatin Sarna said that the last few years were quite hard and depressing for him. "I wasn't getting the kind of work I wanted...I felt...nothing was happening around me and started feeling...depressed...Moreover, I was staying alone," he added. Jatin said he didn't take "any clinical help" but "a year of introspection" and "close friends" helped him heal.

5.title: Bihar starts survey to prepare exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts
5.article_body: The Bihar government is in the process of preparing an exclusive environment plan for all 38 districts of the state to address the local environmental issues, BSPCB Member Secretary, S Chandrasekar, said. BSPCB has engaged an agency to conduct a survey in all the districts to prepare the district environment plan and the agency has started the work, he added.

6.title: 19 presumed dead as boat carrying 23 migrants capsizes near Libya
6.article_body: Authorities have said that 19 people are missing and presumed dead after a boat carrying about 23 migrants capsized in Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Libya on Saturday. Three people have been rescued and sent to the hospital, while one body has been retrieved, Libya's coast guard said. The boat had set off from Tobruk, the coast guard added.

7.title: Mumbai woman injured while trying to resist chain snatcher inside running train
7.article_body: A woman sustained injuries on her neck while trying to resist a suspected chain snatcher inside a running train in Mumbai. The woman was travelling to Churchgate in women's coach. When the train halted at Charni Road railway station, the accused entered the coach and tried to steal her gold chain. The woman resisted and chased the thief, who escaped.

8.title: PM Bennett did not ask Zelenskyy to take Putin's deal: Israel, Ukraine
8.article_body: A media report claiming that Israel PM Naftali Bennett suggested Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to give in to Russian demands was denied by both countries. "At no point did PM Bennett advise President Zelenskyy to take a deal from Putin," said an Israeli official. A Ukrainian adviser said Israel "does not offer Ukraine to agree to any demands" of Russia.

9.title: Arvind Kejriwal, Bhagwant Mann visit Golden Temple in Amritsar ahead of roadshow
9.article_body: Punjab CM designate Bhagwant Mann and AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar, ahead of their roadshow to mark the party's victory in Punjab polls. Mann received Kejriwal and party leader Manish Sisodia at Amritsar airport today. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

10.title: Shatrughan Sinha, Babul Supriyo to fight for TMC in West Bengal bypolls: Mamata
10.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday took to Twitter to announce that veteran actor and former Union Minister Shatrughan Sinha will be TMC's candidate in Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Mamata further stated that singer and former Union Minister Babul Supriyo will be the party's candidate in Assembly by-election from Ballygunge seat.

11.title: Massive fire that broke out at Kolkata tannery yet to be extinguished after 16 hrs
11.article_body: The massive fire which broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Tangra area of West Bengal's Kolkata on Saturday night, is yet to be extinguished even after over 16 hours. Officials said firefighters haven't been able to enter the godown due to the presence of some highly inflammable materials inside. Two fire brigade personnel have sustained injuries.

12.title: Punjab win gives AAP, our model of governance national recognition: Manish Sisodia
12.article_body: AAP leader Manish Sisodia said that the party’s massive victory in Punjab gives national recognition to the AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal’s model of governance. Sisodia added that when a political party becomes a credible alternative it's bound to emerge as a winner. "Right now, our priority is the people of Punjab. We will focus on fulfilling our promises," Sisodia stated.

13.title: At least 60 killed, dozens injured as Cargo train crashes in Congo
13.article_body: At least 60 people were killed and dozens injured after a cargo train crashed in Congo on Friday. The passengers had reportedly boarded the train illegally. "Seven of the carriages ended up in the ravine," said Clementine Lutanda, the local administrator. The accident occurred when the train fell off the track while going up a slope.

14.title: Ashneer Grover denies owning ₹10-cr dining table, says 'It's not even worth 0.5% of that'
14.article_body: Ashneer Grover has denied a report claiming he spent ₹10 crore on a dining table, saying, "It's not even worth 0.5% of that". He tweeted, "Is it a space rocket? Is it a time machine?...I don't hold Guinness World Record for the most expensive table...Press – don't fall for BharatPe Board (undisclosed sources) lies – you'll lose credibility like them."

15.title: WI earn draw vs Eng in 1st Test despite losing 4 wickets for 8 runs on final day
15.article_body: WI's Jason Holder and Nkrumah Bonner played a total of 239 deliveries on the final day of the first Test against England as the match ended in a draw. Joe Root slammed his 24th Test century in their second innings to help England set a target of 286 runs. WI were reduced to 67/4 before ending game at 147/4.

16.title: China's new local COVID-19 cases triple amid its worst outbreak
16.article_body: China reported 1,807 new local symptomatic coronavirus cases, more than triple than what was reported the previous day, the National Health Commission said on Sunday as the country faces its worst outbreak in two years. Of the total cases, Jilin province reported the highest at 1,412. Earlier, China locked down Jilin's provincial capital city Changchun over spike in COVID-19 cases.

17.title: For actors, performance trumps discomfort: Shruti on kissing Mugdha in show
17.article_body: Actress Shruti Seth, speaking about her on-screen kiss with Mugdha Godse in the upcoming series 'Bloody Brothers', said, "It was funny because both of us had never done a scene like it before." "Shaad (Ali, director) really put us at ease. And then for actors, the performance trumps discomfort so we eventually made it seem totally natural," she added.

18.title: Religious fanaticism, communal hysteria rising in country: RSS
18.article_body: Religious fanaticism and acts of communal hysteria are being spread in the country under the cover of the Constitution and religious freedom, the RSS said in its annual report. "Efforts are afoot to weaken the society by rising various fissiparous tendencies in the Hindu society itself," RSS said in the report.

19.title: Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills: Sachin to Sreesanth
19.article_body: After Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket, Sachin Tendulkar took to Instagram to congratulate the fast bowler. He wrote, "Always rated you as a talented bowler with a lot of skills. Congratulations @sreesanthnair36, on representing India over the years.  All the very best for your 2nd innings."

20.title: Posters criticising Venugopal surface in Kerala after Cong's defeat
20.article_body: Following Congress' defeat in Assembly polls, posters criticising party leader KC Venugopal have surfaced near a party office in Kerala's Kannur. The posters read- "Save Congress- thanks to Venugopal for what happened in five states where Congress was wiped out". State Congress chief K Sudhakaran reacted to this saying that everyone has a "collective responsibility for successes and failures".

21.title: Sonia, Rahul should discharge their duties properly: JD(U) chief
21.article_body: Janata Dal (United) president Rajiv Ranjan alias Lalan Singh has asked senior Congress leaders, Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, to "discharge their duties properly" in order to "save the decline of Congress". He further asked Congress to "come out with a proper roadmap" in the backdrop of the party's defeat in the five states' assembly elections.

22.title: RCB have made the right choice in appointing Plessis as captain: Karthik
22.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said RCB have made the right choice in appointing Faf du Plessis as their captain for the upcoming season. "Faf is at that stage in his career when he's ready to take on the responsibility...he's a great tactician," stated Karthik, who'll also feature for the franchise this season. Karthik was bought by RCB for ₹5.5 crore.

23.title: People in Bollywood never saw me beyond my looks: Dino Morea
23.article_body: Actor Dino Morea in an interview said, "Being good looking sometimes works against you in Bollywood." "Directors don't see me differently. I just get...feedback that you're good looking...I find it...bizarre, what's my look got to do with casting me in a certain character. Just cast me. I can change my look," he said, adding, "People...never saw me beyond my looks."

24.title: CRPF jawan who was home on leave martyred in terror attack in J&K; 2 held
24.article_body: A 34-year-old CRPF jawan, who was home on leave, was martyred after terrorists fired upon him near his home in the Chotipora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Saturday evening. "He succumbed to his injuries while on way to a hospital," a police spokesperson said. Kashmir IGP said two persons have been arrested in connection with the terror crime.

25.title: Congress' Dipika Pandey resigns post debacle in Uttarakhand polls
25.article_body: Congress' Jharkhand MLA Dipika Pandey Singh has resigned as the national secretary, co-in charge of Uttarakhand after the party failed to win the Uttarakhand assembly elections. Singh said in a tweet that she takes "responsibility for the defeat in Uttarakhand" and "thank the leadership for giving the opportunity to serve Congress at the national level".

26.title: WI fined 40% of match fee for slow over-rate against India in Women's WC
26.article_body: West Indies have been fined 40% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against India in their match in the ongoing Women's Cricket World Cup. WI were found to be two overs short of the target after time allowances were taken into consideration. India won the match by 155 runs to register their second win in three games.

27.title: 4 killed as tipper truck hits autorickshaw in Punjab's Mohali
27.article_body: Four persons were killed in a road accident on Kharar-Kurali road, Mohali, after a tipper truck hit an auto-rickshaw. The accident occurred on Friday when the victims were coming towards Kharar to board a train to go to their native place in UP's Badaun district. The truck was seized and the driver was arrested, police said.

28.title: Men sexually harass girl one by one during festival in MP, onlookers record videos
28.article_body: Several men sexually harassed a girl on a street in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur during Bhagoria festival, which is celebrated by tribal people. Police registered a case after a video surfaced online. In the video, the girl was heard screaming as men molested her one by one, and onlookers were seen recording videos with their phones instead of helping the girl.

29.title: Man rapes 11-year-old step daughter in Gurugram, threatens to kill her; arrested
29.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 11-year-old step daughter and threatening to kill her in Gurugram on Saturday. According to police, the girl's mother filed a police complaint against the accused. In the complaint, she said some time after her husband died six years ago, she had married the accused, who is a native of Nepal.

30.title: Bengaluru NCB seize 1.97 kg pseudoephedrine; 2 arrested
30.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau's (NCB) Bengaluru unit has seized 1.97 kg of pseudoephedrine from a consignment headed to New Zealand at a courier centre in the city, officers said. Two people, including a South African national, have also been arrested in the matter. The consignment had 50 spools of metallic yarn, with each concealing about 40 gm of the drug.

31.title: It's not often you see such knocks on turning tracks: Irfan on Shreyas' 92 vs SL
31.article_body: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan has praised Shreyas Iyer for his 92-run knock during India's first innings in the ongoing Test against Sri Lanka. "It was an innings of the highest class...The control was because of the clarity of thought, whether to play forward or back...You won't get to see such knocks on turning tracks often," Irfan stated.

32.title: Mother of AAP's Labh Singh who defeated Punjab CM continues working as sweeper
32.article_body: Baldev Kaur, mother of AAP's Labh Singh Ugoke who won from Bhadaur seat by defeating Congress' CS Channi in Punjab polls, continues to work as a sweeper at a government school in Ugoke village. "I take pride...that my son chose to join a party whose symbol is 'jhaadu', which I've used throughout my life to earn a livelihood," she said.

33.title: WI-Eng Test went on longer than needed, bit disrespectful: Carlos Brathwaite
33.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Carlos Brathwaite has criticised England, stating that they were a "bit disrespectful" by agreeing to a draw in the first Test against West Indies only in the final over of the game. "With two set batsmen playing...and pitch offering nothing, England still felt they could [win]...Would they have done that against India, New Zealand, Pakistan?" asked Brathwaite.

34.title: Posing as customer, man steals car during test drive in Ludhiana
34.article_body: A female employee of an auto agency was robbed at gunpoint by a man who posed as a customer and escaped with SUV he took for a test drive near Doraha, Ludhiana. The accused was captured in the CCTVs installed in the showroom and his face was covered with a mask, Sewa Singh, sub-inspector at Sahnewal Police Station, said.

35.title: Sikkim plans to install vending machines for free sanitary pads in all govt schools
35.article_body: The Sikkim government is set to announce a scheme to install vending machines to provide free sanitary pads in its 210 secondary and senior secondary schools. The state government aims to curb dropout of girl students from schools and raise awareness about menstrual hygiene. "We'll also install incinerators...for proper disposal of pads," state Education Department's Secretary-in-Charge said.

36.title: Denied entry, man stabs 2 women employees at New York museum
36.article_body: A man reportedly stabbed two women employees multiple times at New York City's Museum of Modern Art after he was denied entry since his membership had expired.  The victims were immediately taken to the hospital and are expected to survive. The police said that the perpetrator is known to them and they are trying to locate him.

37.title: Chinese plane crashed into South China Sea on March 1: Taiwan
37.article_body: Taiwan's National Security Bureau Director-General Chen Ming-tong has confirmed that a China's People's Liberation Army Air Force plane had crashed into the South China Sea on March 1, Taiwan News reported. The report also said that Taiwanese media noticed a "sudden drop off" in Y-8 flights through the country's air defence identification zone. China hasn't acknowledged the incident, it added.

38.title: People think therapy is useless, it helped me so much: Jacqueline
38.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has said people think therapy is useless but it helped her a lot. She added that she sought help from a therapist because she was "going through loneliness" in 2020 during the COVID-19 induced lockdown. "I had this amazing therapist. I was doing therapy for some time. And it is amazing," Jacqueline further said.

39.title: Deleted a scene featuring Abhishek, Chunky in 'Bachchhan Paandey': Director
39.article_body: 'Bachchhan Paandey' director Farhad Samji revealed that they've deleted a scene featuring pictures of Abhishek Bachchan and Chunky Panday in the upcoming film. "Kriti and Arshad's characters were looking for Bachchhan Paandey and they ask a...kid if they'd seen him. The kid said yes and pulled out...magazine with pictures of Abhishek and Chunky. We didn't put this scene," he said.

40.title: 21-year-old BMW driver arrested in hit and run case in Delhi after 1 killed
40.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly killed 36-year-old Rahul Chand in a hit and run accident by his BMW car, police said. The driver was held after the police traced him through the car's number plate details. "BMW is in the name of accused, Ashwani Lal, who lives in Indirapuram, Ghaziabad,” said DCP (east) Priyanka Kashyap.

41.title: New mayor appointed in Ukraine's Melitopol after predecessor kidnapped
41.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has appointed Galina Danilchenko as the new mayor of Melitopol city after the elected mayor Ivan Fedorov was reportedly kidnapped by the Russian military. The country's foreign ministry has condemned Fedorov's abduction, calling it a gross violation of international law and a war crime under the Geneva Conventions.

42.title: Many big names in Karnataka to join party soon: AAP's Prithvi Reddy
42.article_body: In four to six weeks, many big names in Karnataka will be joining the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), party leader Prithvi Reddy said while adding that an announcement for the same would be made soon. The party will identify candidates for next year's Assembly elections early so that they could work on their respective constituencies, Reddy added.

43.title: Paytm founder held, released on bail in Feb for ramming car into police vehicle
43.article_body: Paytm CEO and founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma was arrested and released on bail by Delhi Police last month after being booked for rash and negligent driving. A Jaguar Land Rover allegedly being driven by Sharma had rammed into vehicle of DCP (South district) outside The Mother’s International School on Aurobindo Marg. The police also impounded the car after the accident.

44.title: UK shares latest map of Ukraine showing areas controlled by Russia
44.article_body: The UK's Ministry of Defence has shared the latest map of Ukraine showing areas controlled by Russia. The Russian troops have surrounded Mariupol, a port city on the Sea of Azov and are close to cutting off the country's second-largest city Kharkiv. The map also shows the likely axis of advance of the Russian troops.

45.title: China reports highest COVID-19 cases in 2 years with more than 3,300 infections
45.article_body: China reported more than 3,300 COVID-19 infections on Saturday as the country faces its worst outbreak since the early days of the pandemic, Bloomberg reported. There were 1,807 confirmed local infections, 1,315 asymptomatic local cases and more than 200 imported cases, the National Health Commission said on Sunday. The northeastern province of Jilin accounted for more than 2,100 cases.

46.title: 19 cow carcasses found near railway track in Punjab; probe ordered
46.article_body: At least 19 headless cow carcasses, with their skins removed, have been found at an abandoned place near a railway track on Saturday in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, SP (Investigation) Mukhtiar Rai said. Following this, a two-member committee was formed to probe the matter. Political leaders also blocked traffic in a protest over the incident and lifted the blockade after police assurance.

47.title: Australia record their biggest win by runs against NZ in Women's World Cups
47.article_body: Australia recorded their biggest win (by runs) against New Zealand in Women's ODI World Cups after beating them by 141 runs in the ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. Australia posted 269/8 in 50 overs and then restricted New Zealand to 128/10 in 30.2 overs with Darcie Brown picking three wickets. It's Australia's third straight win in the tournament.

48.title: Over 700 exotic birds kept in cages for illegal sale rescued in Tamil Nadu
48.article_body: Forest department officials in Tamil Nadu's Trichy conducted raids at various locations in a crackdown against illegal trade of exotic birds. Officials said over 600 green parrots and 100 starlings were kept in cages for sale in Trichy. The accused who were engaged in the illegal trade of exotic birds will be fined under Wild Life (Protection) Act, officials added.

49.title: One of the quicker bowlers has to be workhorse, Shami does that: Gavaskar
49.article_body: With India restricting Sri Lanka to 86/6 at stumps on Day 1 in the ongoing second Test, Sunil Gavaskar called Mohammad Shami a "workhorse", praising his ability to bowl long spells while maintaining pace. "Shami is somebody who can bowl long spells, sustain that pace, and can build pressure...You need somebody like that. He has been terrific," Gavaskar added.

50.title: India reports 3,116 new COVID-19 cases, 47 deaths in 24 hours
50.article_body: India has reported 3,116 new COVID-19 cases and 47 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 3,614 cases and 89 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 38,069, while the death toll in the country reached 5,15,850.

51.title: KTR warns of cutting power supply to Secunderabad military area
51.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday warned that water and power supply to the military authorities in the Secunderabad Cantonment area will be cut if they don't stop causing inconvenience to the people. It's "not fair" for the military authorities to close roads whenever they want, he added. A BJP spokesperson called Rao's remarks "shocking".

52.title: Holi celebrations to be held in Gr Noida City Park on March 16; entry free
52.article_body: The Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority will organise a two-hour long event to celebrate Holi in City Park on March 16. The event will be held from 5 pm to 7 pm and the entry will be free, said GNIDA. The event will feature Mathura's Charkula and Gagri dance recitals and a performance by Braj folk singer Dr Seema Morwal.

53.title: 4 members of inter-state drug peddling gang arrested in Ludhiana
53.article_body: The Ludhiana Police busted an inter-state drug peddling gang allegedly involved in the supply of ganja (cannabis), poppy husk and opium into Punjab. Police have arrested four members of the gang and claimed recovery of 2.04 quintals of ganja, 3 kg poppy husk and 500 grams of opium from them, allegedly smuggled from Odisha.

54.title: Assam man lynched, set on fire by mob for allegedly killing 5-yr-old child
54.article_body: A 35-year-old man, accused of killing a child, was allegedly lynched and later set on fire by a mob in a paddy field in Assam's Dibrugarh on Saturday. The incident took place after the accused allegedly stabbed a five-year-old child to death with a machete at a tea estate, police said. The mob attacked the accused with machetes and sticks.

55.title: Ronaldo breaks world record for scoring most goals in football history, claim Man Utd
55.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored a hat-trick for Manchester United against Tottenham Hotspur in Premier League on Saturday, taking his tally of professional goals for club and country to 807. As per Manchester United, Ronaldo broke the world record for scoring most goals in football history. Ronaldo surpassed late Austro-Czech footballer Josef Bican, who's estimated to have scored 805 goals by FIFA.

56.title: 12 missiles fired towards US consulate in Iraq from Iran: Officials
56.article_body: Twelve missiles were fired towards the US consulate in Iraq's northern city of Irbil on Sunday, Iraqi security officials said. A US defense official said missiles had been launched from neighbouring Iran. Another US official said there was no damage and no casualties at any US government facility, but Iraqi officials said several missiles had hit the US consulate.

57.title: People understood BJP should come to power if development is needed: Smriti Irani
57.article_body: After BJP’s victory in four of the five states where polls were held recently, Union Minister Smriti Irani said people understood that if they need development in the country, the BJP government should come to power. Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav’s EVM allegation, Irani said that EVMs were just an excuse.

58.title: You can't play negative shots or just keep defending: Iyer on 92(98) vs SL
58.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer, who smashed 10 fours and 4 sixes in his 92-run knock to help India post 252 in their first innings against Sri Lanka, has said batting with a defensive mindset doesn't help on turning wickets. "My plan...was to cut down the spin (negate turn), so I decided to step out [while batting]," he added.

59.title: 'The Kashmir Files' makers Vivek Agnihotri, Abhishek Agarwal meet PM Modi
59.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' team, including director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri, actress Pallavi Joshi and producer Abhishek Agarwal, met PM Narendra Modi on Saturday. Abhishek took to Twitter to share some pictures from the meeting and wrote, "It was a pleasure to meet our Hon'ble PM Shri Narendra Modi. What makes it more special is his...noble words about #TheKashmirFiles...Thank you, Modi Ji."

60.title: 21-yr-old DU graduate found hanging in Delhi; probe on
60.article_body: A 21-year-old man who graduated from Delhi University's Hansraj College was found hanging from a ceiling fan in Delhi's Vijay Nagar. The body was found by his flatmate and locals. The police said they didn't find any suicide note and started a probe. The man reportedly hailed from UP and had recently landed a job in Noida.

61.title: Pune police file 3,500-page chargesheet in MHADA paper leak case
61.article_body: Pune police have filed a 3,500-page chargesheet against the director of a private firm and two agents in connection with the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) paper leak case. The three - Dr Pritesh Deshmukh, Ankush Harkal and Santosh Harkal - have been accused of seeking lakhs of rupees from candidates in a recruitment drive for 565 posts.

62.title: Chhattisgarh teacher comes to school drunk, beats students with bat; suspended
62.article_body: A school teacher in Chhattisgarh allegedly reached school drunk and beat the students with a cricket bat, according to the District Collector. Following the incident, the District Collector issued an order suspending the teacher with immediate effect. The incident took place on March 10, when the teacher arrived at the school after consuming liquor.

63.title: 20-yr-old Gr Noida man shoots sister dead for objecting to his drinking habits
63.article_body: A 32-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her 20-year-old brother at their residence in Greater Noida for objecting to his drinking habits. Police said the accused had come home intoxicated and had started puking when his sister scolded him. The accused, who had a pistol with him, started arguing with her and later escaped after shooting her dead.

64.title: Virat wants to enjoy his time at RCB as batsman, we respect that: Hesson
64.article_body: Talking about their decision to appoint Faf du Plessis as captain for the upcoming season, RCB's Director of Cricket Mike Hesson said it was clear that Virat Kohli wanted a break, which is why he stepped down as captain after last season. "Virat wants to enjoy his time as a batsman and we are very respectful of that," Hesson added.

65.title: Pune police arrest 2 cyber experts for misleading cryptocurrency probe
65.article_body: Pune police have arrested two cyber experts for allegedly misleading a probe into a cryptocurrency cheating case in which 17 people were arrested. The two, who were expected to assist police in the case, transferred seized cryptocurrency from national and international wallets to themselves and their partners, said police. One of them allegedly submitted manipulated screenshots to the police.

66.title: 2 assault watchman, steal ₹1.6 lakh-material from firm in Pune
66.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a 68-year-old watchman with a sharp weapon and a brick and then stealing material worth about ₹1.6 lakh from a steel firm in Pune. A police official said that the duo had apparently scaled the main gate to enter the premises and later opened the gate to let their other accomplices in.

67.title: Bengaluru traffic police officer helps 80-yr-old man find his home
67.article_body: Bengaluru's Rajajinagar Traffic Police Station on Sunday tweeted that a traffic police officer, who was on duty in the area, had helped an 80-year-old man who'd gone missing from his house. It said that the police officer had tracked down the man's home and contacted his family by phone. The traffic police station also shared a picture of the incident.

68.title: Ukraine shares 'Spider-Man' meme to show damaged Russian tank
68.article_body: The official Twitter account of Ukraine shared a 'Spider-Man' meme to show a damaged Russian tank. Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed over 12,000 Russian soldiers, destroyed 362 Russian tanks and 1,205 armoured vehicles of other types amid the war. Russia had started invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

69.title: Virat Kohli's gestures to Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' go viral
69.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli's gestures to the Bengaluru crowd chanting 'RCB RCB' during the second India-Sri Lanka Test have gone viral. Kohli was seen making a heart sign with his hands as the crowd chanted 'RCB RCB'. Kohli also pulled up his Team India shirt to reveal a red coloured apparel below it as the crowd chanted for RCB.

70.title: Mumbai psychologist held for selling brownies laced with hashish, opium denied bail
70.article_body: A special Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) court has rejected a 24-year-old psychologist's bail plea, who was arrested with 10 kilograms of hashish-laden brownies. The accused was practising in a renowned hospital in south Mumbai. Mumbai's Narcotics Control Bureau unit claimed that the accused baked brownies with a mixture of hashish and opium and supplied them to several clients.

71.title: Satellite images show fires, damage to residential buildings in Ukraine
71.article_body: Satellite images showed damage to civilian infrastructure and residential buildings throughout the Ukrainian city of Mariupol. Maxar Technologies said fires were seen in the western section of the Black Sea port city and several high-rise buildings had been severely damaged. Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said Mariupol was besieged by Russian forces but was still under Ukrainian control.

72.title: Hailey Bieber hospitalised after suffering brain-related 'medical emergency'
72.article_body: Model Hailey Bieber, the wife of singer Justin Bieber, was reportedly hospitalised with a brain condition that could possibly be linked to COVID-19. As per reports, Hailey, who has been discharged, was admitted after suffering a "medical emergency" that affected the way she moved. A report claimed that 25-year-old Hailey showed symptoms that were more typical of an older person.

73.title: 31-year-old woman blown up by Russian tank as she went to get medicine for sick mother
73.article_body: A 31-year-old Ukrainian woman named Valeriia Maksetska, who was leaving her Kyiv home to collect medicine for her sick mother, was reportedly blown up by a Russian tank. She was allegedly killed alongside her mother and driver in a village near Kyiv. USAID administrator Samantha Power tweeted that they were waiting in a car for a Russian convoy to pass.

74.title: French woman alleges sexual abuse by Kerala tattoo artist accused in 6 other cases
74.article_body: A French national has alleged that she was sexually abused by Sujeesh PS who was arrested after several female clients accused him of crimes including rape. The woman claimed she was abused by Sujeesh in 2019 during a trip to Kochi, police said. Six cases were registered against him after an 18-year-old opened up about being raped by him.

75.title: Couldn't be happier to pass on baton: Kohli on Du Plessis as new RCB captain
75.article_body: Reacting to Faf du Plessis' appointment as the new RCB captain, Virat Kohli said he couldn't be "happier" to pass on the baton to a "good friend". He added, "We've been in touch for many years now...absolutely excited for him to lead RCB and to play under him." Kohli had stepped down as RCB's captain after IPL 2021.

76.title: Ranveer Singh gets 'Number 1' jersey from football icon Ledley King, pic viral
76.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who is currently in the UK to attend the Premier League games, shared a picture with Tottenham legend Ledley King. Ledley gifted Ranveer a customised 'Number 1' jersey. The actor also opted to do the 'Dare Skywalk' at the stadium and shared that the "42 metre drop over the edge of the grand stadium" was "exhilarating".

77.title: Man throws son from 2nd floor after fire in US house; video shows police catching him
77.article_body: A man threw his three-year-old son from the second floor window of an apartment building on fire before jumping out to officers below. A video of the incident shows the police officers and firefighters catching the boy. "Pass the baby down...we got it," the officers could be heard saying in the video.

78.title: Punjab people's security more important than security of few: Mann
78.article_body: After an order was issued to withdraw security cover of 122 politicians including former MLAs and ministers, Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann said, "I think the security of the people of Punjab is more important than the security of few people." He added police stations are lying vacant. "We will take only police work from police force," the AAP leader said.

79.title: Ukraine bans export of fertilisers amid conflict with Russia
79.article_body: Ukraine, a major global producer of agricultural products, on Saturday banned the exports of fertilisers amid Russia's invasion of the country. The ban would help "to maintain balance in the domestic market" and applied to nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium and complex fertilisers, the country's Agriculture Ministry said. Earlier, Ukraine had banned exports of some agricultural commodities.

80.title: A brand new start for me in a new franchise: RCB captain Du Plessis
80.article_body: Newly-appointed RCB captain Faf du Plessis has said representing the franchise is a challenge for him as it's a brand new start for him in a new franchise. The 37-year-old, who until last year represented CSK, was picked by Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹7 crore at IPL mega auction last month. "So excited at [all] levels," Du Plessis added.

81.title: World's 5th richest person Buffett got $373,000 in compensation for 2021
81.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman and CEO Warren Buffett received $373,204 in compensation for 2021, including his salary and security cost, down from $380,328 a year ago. Buffett's 16.2% stake in Berkshire comprises most of his $117.9 billion net worth, making him the world's fifth richest person. Buffett has been receiving an annual salary of $100,000 for more than four decades now.

82.title: Man shot dead after injuring 3 French police officers in knife attack
82.article_body: A French man was shot dead by the police in France's Marseille after he attacked them with a knife on Saturday, leaving three police officers injured, authorities said. French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said that the attacker was not known to the police and had no police record. The motive for the attack was not immediately known.

83.title: Want to create digital blockade: Ukraine Vice PM as he asks firms to pull out of Russia
83.article_body: Ukraine's Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov, who has been urging tech companies to pull out of Russia, said his goal is to create a "digital blockade" so that Russians question the war. The 31-year-old minister in an interview revealed that he has been worried about his father, who has been in intensive care after a missile struck the house next door.

84.title: 15 fire tenders mobilised as massive fire breaks out at Kolkata tannery
84.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a tannery in Meher Ali Lane in Kolkata's Tangra on Saturday and 15 fire tenders reached the spot to douse the flames. Two fire brigade personnel were injured during the firefighting operations and were rushed to the hospital. Although the situation is under control, the extent of damage isn't known yet, an official said.

85.title: K'taka man attacks wife for filing divorce after learning about 1st wife
85.article_body: A man in Karnataka, Mohammad Ejaz Shiroor, has been arrested for allegedly attacking his wife Apoorva Puranik alias Arfa Bhanu on Thursday in Gadag district after she sought divorce. The victim, who changed her name after the wedding, had learnt about a year ago that Ejaz was already married and had three kids. The divorce matter was listed for Friday.

86.title: Baldwin tried to reach settlement to finish filming 'Rust': Report
86.article_body: Actor-producer Alec Baldwin had tried to reach a settlement to finish the filming of 'Rust' after a shooting incident which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins. Alec has submitted a filing which states that the cast and crew did not want to return to New Mexico. It further states that Baldwin convinced them to finish filming to honour Halyna's talent and legacy.

87.title: Central Railway earns ₹2.48 cr in 2021-2022 from film shootings
87.article_body: In the 2021-22 financial year, Central Railway earned over ₹2.48 crore by offering its premises and coaches for film shootings. It's the highest-ever revenue for any financial year, with Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) being the most prefered location. Different locations of Central Railway witnessed the shooting of ten films, two web series and a short film during the year.

88.title: Not a surprise to me: ABD on Faf du Plessis being named RCB captain
88.article_body: After RCB named Faf du Plessis as their captain ahead of IPL 2022, ex-South Africa cricketer AB de Villiers said, "The announcement comes as no surprise to me after RCB picked up Faf at...[mega] auction." He added that Du Plessis is an "amazing leader and the perfect man" for the job. "He has a fantastic tactical mind," he further said.

89.title: Moscow-Kyiv crisis talks have continued via video link: Kremlin
89.article_body: Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov on Saturday said crisis talks between Moscow and Kyiv have continued via video link after in-person talks held in Belarus, reported RIA news agency. Peskov added Russian President Vladimir Putin briefed French President Emmanuel Macron, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on the negotiations held recently. Meanwhile, UN said 579 civilians were killed in Ukraine so far.

90.title: Paytm Payments Bank issues statement after RBI bars it from taking new customers
90.article_body: A day after RBI directed Paytm Payments Bank to stop onboarding new customers with immediate effect, the company issued a statement saying they are taking immediate steps to comply with RBI directions. It added, "We shall notify when we recommence the opening of new accounts after obtaining RBI approval." It also said the accounts of existing customers are fully functional.

91.title: 579 civilians including 42 children killed in Ukraine so far: UN
91.article_body: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Saturday said 579 civilians, including 42 children, were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24. The office added over 1,000 others were injured so far. As per OHCHR, most civilians were killed due to use of explosive weapons such as heavy artillery shelling and missile strikes.

92.title: India lose 1-2 vs Germany in shootout at Women's Pro Hockey League
92.article_body: India lost 1-2 to Germany in a shootout after both the teams were tied at 1-1 at the end of 60-minute regulation time in first match of double-leg FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Bhubaneswar on Saturday. Navneet Kaur, who scored the goal for India in the fourth minute, hit the only goal for her side in the shootout.

93.title: People are behaving as if I have no other work: Archana on memes on her & Sidhu
93.article_body: Archana Puran Singh, speaking about memes after Navjot Singh Sidhu lost in Punjab Assembly elections, told ETimes, "When there's something new happening to Sidhu, memes are made on me. Isn't that strange?" "People...are behaving as if I only have this job...and no other work...If...Sidhu decides to come back [on The Kapil Sharma Show] I'm willing to move on," she added.

94.title: 16 wickets fall on Day 1 of Day-Night Test, Sri Lanka trail India by 166 runs
94.article_body: As many as 16 wickets fell on the Day 1 of Day-Night Test between India and Sri Lanka in Bengaluru as Sri Lanka ended the day at 86/6, trailing India by 166 runs. Jasprit Bumrah took three wickets, while Mohammad Shami picked two. Earlier in the day, India were dismissed for 252 in first innings with Shreyas Iyer scoring 92(98).

95.title: Reduction in EPFO interest rate BJP's return gift after poll win: Cong
95.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said the reduction in Employees' Provident Fund Organisation interest rate was a "return gift" of the BJP to people after it won Assembly elections in four states. "Is it right to attack...savings of crores of employees on...basis of electoral victory?" he asked. EPFO has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1%.

96.title: Earlier you were asked to compromise to bag roles: Ekta Jain
96.article_body: Actress Ekta Jain in an interview has stated that actresses were earlier asked to compromise to bag roles which had put her off. "The circumstances at that time were really tough for television actors," the actress added. Ekta further said that the industry has drastically transformed and now people are looking for talent and good artistes instead of stars.

97.title: Former Zambian President Rupiah Banda passes away at 85
97.article_body: Former Zambian President Rupiah Bwezani Banda passed away on Friday at his home in capital Lusaka at the age of 85 after a two-year battle with colon cancer. Banda's death was confirmed by his son, Andrew and Zambia's current President Hakainde Hichilema. "We appreciate his service to the nation," Hichilema said during a televised address to the nation.

98.title: RS to get 19 hrs of extra work time in upcoming Budget session
98.article_body: The Rajya Sabha will get 19 hours of additional time for business over the earlier schedule in the second part of the Budget session that is set to begin from March 14. The House will sit from 11 am till 6 pm, with a one-hour lunch break. The first part of the Budget session had concluded on February 11.

99.title: Azim Premji forgives person who filed 70 cases against him; SC praises him
99.article_body: The Supreme Court praised former Wipro Chairman Azim Hasham Premji after he agreed to forgive the person who through his companies filed over 70 cases against Premji and his associates. "We're happy to note that Mr Azim Hasham Premji has taken a constructive view of the matter and agreed to forgive the past conduct of Mr Subramanian," the court said.

100.title: I apologise to Kashmiri Hindus for my indifference: The Kashmir Files' Prakash
100.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' actor Prakash Belawadi has posted a video apologising to the Kashmiri Pandits for his "indifference" to their mass exodus from the state. "I feel mortified, I also feel guilty as I was a journalist at that time and prided myself as someone equipped with...contemporary events, but I see it was not the case," the actor said.

101.title: Ukraine shares how it's spending crypto donations, says 'they're saving lives'
101.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy Minister of Digital Transformation Alex Bornyakov tweeted, "Each and every helmet and vest bought via crypto donations is currently saving Ukrainian soldiers' lives." He said the funds are being used to buy bulletproof vests, helmets, thermal imagers and optics, medicines, and packed lunches for Ukraine's armed forces. Ukraine has received nearly $100 million in crypto donations.

102.title: Saudi Arabia executes 81 people in 1 day in its biggest mass execution
102.article_body: Saudi Arabia on Saturday executed 81 people who were convicted of various terror offences. This marked the kingdom's largest-known mass execution in its modern history. Saturday's executions exceeded the total number of executions in Saudi Arabia in the whole of last year. Saudi state television described those executed as having "followed the footsteps of Satan" in carrying out the crimes.

103.title: Vietnam bans Sony's 'Uncharted' over disputed South China Sea map
103.article_body: Sony's action movie "Uncharted" has been banned in Vietnam over a scene featuring a disputed map of the South China Sea. The scene shows the U-shaped "nine-dash line" that is used by China to stake its claim to large parts of the sea. China's claim in the sea includes areas claimed by other countries in the region.

104.title: Turkmenistan President's son likely to win snap presidential election
104.article_body: Serdar Berdimuhamedov, son of Turkmenistan's President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov, is likely to win Saturday's snap presidential election. Currently, Deputy Prime Minister, 40-year-old Serdar has been facing token competition from eight other nominal candidates in the vote. In power since 2007, President Berdimuhamedov called the snap election last month paving way for a generation of new leaders.

105.title: US using bats and birds as biological weapons, claims Russia
105.article_body: Russia has accused the US and Ukraine at the UN security council of a plot to use migratory birds and bats to spread pathogens. Russia's UN ambassador, Vassily Nebenzia, said the birds, bats and insects would cross Ukraine's western border. The UN said it was "not aware of any biological weapons programmes" in Ukraine.

106.title: K'taka Cong leader resigns, says, 'Couldn't speak to Sonia or Rahul'
106.article_body: CM Ibrahim, former Union Minister and senior Congress leader from Karnataka, tendered his resignation to party's interim chief Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. He said despite being a senior leader, he couldn't speak to Sonia or former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi directly. He said Sonia assured him of changes within Congress in the last 12 years, but he didn't see them.

107.title: Meta cuts on-site perks including free laundry, valet service for employees
107.article_body: Meta Platforms, Facebook's parent company, has informed its employees about cutting down various on-site perks including free laundry, dry cleaning and valet service. The company also announced that it would delay the free dinner time from 6 pm to 6:30 pm. While Meta offered a remote work option, many employees are scheduled to return to the office on March 28.

108.title: Can't blame Kohli for the way he got out: Parthiv on India-SL 2nd Test
108.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's LBW dismissal on Day 1 of second Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium against Sri Lanka, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said the ex-captain can't be blamed for the way he got out. "Pitch is so bad that he could've done nothing about it...ball was spinning...kept a bit low," he added. Off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva took Kohli's wicket.

109.title: Guatemala receives first arrivals of Ukrainians fleeing war
109.article_body: Guatemala on Friday received first arrivals of Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion in their homeland. The eight Ukrainians were the first to arrive in the Central American country for humanitarian reasons, an immigration spokesperson said. The officials added another flight carrying more Ukrainians arrived hours later. Meanwhile, UN said over 2.6 million Ukrainians fled the country so far.

110.title: AAP to contest all 68 seats in Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections
110.article_body: After a win in Punjab, Aam Aadmi Party said it'll contest all 68 seats in the Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. AAP leader Satyendar Jain said that health and education systems are in a bad state in Himachal Pradesh, adding that AAP will form the government in the state. Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections are scheduled to be held in November.

111.title: Completely incorrect: Congress as report claims Rahul, Sonia and Priyanka will resign
111.article_body: Congress has dismissed a report claiming that Congress President Sonia Gandhi and leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will resign at Congress Working Committee meeting on Sunday over performance in recent elections. Congress Spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala said the report "based on unnamed sources is completely unfair, mischievous and incorrect".

112.title: UN is negotiating to create aid corridors in Ukraine: Official
112.article_body: The United Nations is negotiating with both sides in the conflict in Ukraine to create corridors to deliver aid, the UN's crisis coordinator for the European country said. As many as 12 million Ukrainians may need aid, the official added. The most pressing humanitarian needs are in Mariupol, a besieged city in eastern Ukraine, the official further said.

113.title: He could've funded it himself: Lawyer on Musk's 'taking Tesla private' tweet
113.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's lawyer told a US court the billionaire is rich enough that he could've funded Tesla's going-private transaction himself. He was referring to Musk's 2018 tweet claiming he was considering taking Tesla private and that he had secured the funding. The lawyer said, "None of Musk's deals have ever had a funding issue...[He has] great personal resources."

114.title: RCB unveil their new jersey with stylised lion, share pics
114.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) have unveiled their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. The jersey includes a stylised lion at the back. RCB announced that they have simplified their jersey as compared to the previous kit. RCB will face Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

115.title: Agreed to maintain stability: India, China after 15th round of talks
115.article_body: After holding the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on Friday, India and China released a joint statement, claiming that both sides agreed to maintain stability on the ground in the western sector. "They agreed to maintain dialogue via military and diplomatic channels to reach a mutually acceptable resolution of the remaining issues at the earliest," the statement read.

116.title: 13 states/UTs record 'above normal' temperatures in last 24 hours; IMD releases list
116.article_body: The IMD has released the names of 13 states/UTs that recorded 'above normal' maximum temperatures in the last 24 hours. The regions include Gujarat, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Rajasthan, Goa, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram and Tripura. Moreover, heat wave conditions are likely in Saurashtra-Kutch, interior Odisha and west Rajasthan over the next few days.

117.title: 2 men crowdfund money to buy Caribbean island & start their own nation
117.article_body: Gareth Johnson and Marshall Mayer launched a crowdfunding campaign and raised £250,000 (₹2.5 crore) to purchase an uninhabited island in the Caribbean. They completed the purchase of Coffee Caye, a 1.2-acre island off the coast of Belize. The island, albeit not officially recognised as a nation, is named 'Principality of Islandia' and has its own national flag, anthem and government.

118.title: He used to ask for movie tickets: Bellamkonda Suresh on ₹85 lakh cheating case
118.article_body: Telugu producer Bellamkonda Suresh, responding to the ₹85 lakh cheating case against him, said VL Sravan Kumar is from his village and used to ask for movie tickets. Kumar alleged that Suresh and his son took money from him in 2018 to make a movie. "I've not taken a single penny from anyone...I will file a defamation case," Suresh said.

119.title: People of Russia not the enemy: Mila amid Russian invasion of Ukraine
119.article_body: Actress Mila Kunis, speaking about Russia's invasion of Ukraine, has said the people of Russia are not the enemy, adding that it's not being said enough in the press. She was born in Ukraine in 1983 and moved to USA in 1991. Mila added she felt like a part of her heart got ripped out after hearing about the attacks.

120.title: Didn't bowl as wanted, gave many short balls: Stafanie on WI's loss
120.article_body: West Indies captain Stafanie Taylor said her side didn't bowl the way they wanted to following their 155-run loss against India in Women's World Cup. "Gave away too many short balls...Harmanpreet Kaur and Smriti Mandhana batted really well. We just couldn't get back from that," she added. Chasing a 318-run target, West Indies were all-out for 162 in 40.3 overs.

121.title: S Korea logs record over 3.8 lakh new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
121.article_body: South Korean health authorities on Saturday said the country reported 3,83,665 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, logging its highest single-day tally since the pandemic began. As per Korea Disease Control and Prevention Agency (KDCA), Gyeonggi province reported 1,07,943 infections, whereas capital Seoul recorded 80,437 cases. KDCA added that 269 deaths were reported in the same period.

122.title: UK-based startup Space Forge aim to launch country's 1st satellite
122.article_body: UK-based startup Space Forge and Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit may launch Britain's first satellite over this summer. "We're thrilled to be making UK history with our first launch," said Space Forge CEO Joshua Western. The CEO added that this is the start of a great collaboration. Space Forge's microgravity satellite, ForgeStar will be launched aboard Virgin Orbit's LauncherOne rocket.

123.title: Caribbean coral reefs have been warming for at least 100 years: Study
123.article_body: US researchers stated Caribbean coral reefs have been warming for at least 100 years. The team analysed sea-surface temperatures and revealed that the reefs were warming since 1915. However, they added that in four out of eight sub-regions, warming may have started during second half of nineteenth century. The team studied 5,326 coral reefs across eight Caribbean regions.

124.title: Elon Musk keeps his word: Ukraine Vice PM after receiving 2nd shipment of Starlink
124.article_body: Ukrainian Vice PM Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to thank Tesla CEO Elon Musk after receiving the second shipment of Starlink terminals. Fedorov tweeted, "Received the second shipment of Starlink stations! Elon Musk keeps his word! Thank you for supporting Ukraine and peace in the entire world!" SpaceX had delivered the first batch of Starlink to Ukraine earlier this month.

125.title: Germany, Qatar discuss bilateral cooperation in energy, investments
125.article_body: Jörg Kukies, State Secretary to German Chancellery on Saturday said the government discussed bilateral cooperation in energy and corporate investments with Qatar. Kukies added he held talks with Qatar's Deputy Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani on March 9. This comes as the German government has been working to lessen the country's reliance on Russian oil and gas.

126.title: Putin may pay the price with armed escort to grave or retirement: Ex-Russian Minister
126.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine war, former Russian Minister Andrei Kozyrev has said President Vladimir Putin might "pay the price with an armed escort either to the grave or to retirement". "With Putin, I very much expect there to be resistance growing...that will be resolved one way or another...I don't know which way but Russian history is full of unexpected outcomes," he added.

127.title: Look into the eyes of our defenders: Ukraine as it shares pics of people fighting Russia
127.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has shared a collage of people fighting against Russia amid the war. "Look into the eyes of our defenders," the post's caption read. "There is no fear in their eyes...God bless all of Ukraine," a comment read while another Twitter user wrote, "I see love, life and determination in their eyes. Ukraine will win."

128.title: Woman beheads husband & keeps head in family temple in Tripura, arrested
128.article_body: A 42-year-old woman allegedly beheaded her 50-year-old husband and kept the blood-soaked head in a plastic bag at the family's temple in Tripura's Khowai on Saturday, a police officer said. The couple's elder son said that his mother developed a psychological disorder and underwent treatment by a local occultist. She has been arrested, police said.

129.title: Ex-bank manager among 12 sent to jail in loan fraud case in Hyd
129.article_body: A special court for CBI cases in Hyderabad has sentenced 12 people, including a former bank manager, to jail for up to five years in a housing loan fraud case dating back to 2004. The ex-manager of a Central Bank of India branch was identified as the main accused. He was asked to pay a fine of ₹2.25 lakh.

130.title: What worked for us was our approach, attitude: Mithali on India's win vs WI
130.article_body: Praising India after they defeated West Indies by 155 runs in 2022 Women's World Cup, India skipper Mithali Raj said she couldn't have asked for a better effort from her side. "Everybody knew about the importance of this game...what worked for us was our approach and attitude," she added. India's 317/8 was their highest-ever total in a Women's World Cup.

131.title: Man cheated of ₹4.3 lakh in Mumbai by woman claiming to be doctor
131.article_body: A 33-year-old bank officer working in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹4.30 lakh by a woman, who befriended him on Facebook and claimed she was a London-based doctor. The accused made him believe that she needed money to clear customs and he paid money frequently. On realising that he was cheated, he approached Kalachowki Police and registered a complaint.

132.title: Bengaluru can't grow in an unplanned way: Karnataka CM Bommai
132.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said the state capital, Bengaluru, can't grow in an unplanned way. He took to Twitter and said, "We need to develop high class, smart and self-sufficient [Satellite Towns] with hi-tech communication systems, that offer ease of living, travelling and of doing business and intermediate specific cities [like] health cities and education cities etc."

133.title: Pakistan seeks joint probe into accidental missile fire by India
133.article_body: Pakistan on Saturday demanded a joint probe into the incident involving the accidental firing of an Indian missile into its territory. "Such a serious matter cannot be addressed with the simplistic explanation proffered by the Indian authorities," said Pakistan's foreign office. India had blamed a "technical malfunction" during routine maintenance for the missile fire.

134.title: Woman submits fake educational documents to get job in Pune; booked
134.article_body: A woman allegedly forged educational documents to secure a job with the Maharashtra Police in place of her husband after his death in Pune. The woman reportedly wanted to get a job in the Criminal Investigation Department of Maharashtra Police as her husband was a police sub-inspector in the fingerprint department of CID. She has now been booked by police.

135.title: Hyd Traffic Police's green channel helps transport of live organs
135.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police on Saturday created a green channel to facilitate the transport of live organs from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Shamshabad to KIMS Hospitals in Begumpet. The channel was created in coordination with Cyberabad Traffic Police. "We would like to thank...Hyderabad Traffic Police and Cyberabad Traffic Police for providing a green channel," KIMS Hospitals tweeted.

136.title: Pics from space show Ukrainian shopping centre before & after Russian invasion
136.article_body: Satellite pictures by Maxar Technologies show the destruction caused after Russian invasion of Ukraine. Before and after pictures show a shopping centre in Ukraine's Chernihiv completely damaged after Russian invasion. "This is the first time in my life when I have to excavate the graves to bury five coffins together," city's mayor Vladyslav Atroshenko said.

137.title: China allows COVID antigen self-test kits for 1st time as daily cases hit 2-yr high
137.article_body: China for the first time has permitted the use of COVID-19 antigen self-test kits for the general public. It has granted approval to five COVID-19 antigen kits made by local companies for this. On Friday, China reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily count in around two years.

138.title: 122 former MLAs, ministers lose security day after Mann meets Punjab DGP
138.article_body: A day after Bhagwant Mann, who is set to become Punjab CM, met state DGP VK Bhawra, the Additional Director General of Police (Security) issued an order to withdraw security cover of 122 politicians, including former ministers and MLAs. Nineteen security officers were withdrawn from Manpreet Singh Badal's cover. A Congress leader, Badal served as Punjab's Finance Minister.

139.title: IISc B'luru develops paper-based sensor to detect hydrogen peroxide
139.article_body: Researchers at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru, have developed a simpler way, a paper-based sensor, for detecting even tiny volumes of hydrogen peroxide. The chemical is widely used in products like hand sanitiser as a disinfectant. The paper-based sensor can reportedly be used to check household and healthcare products' quality and for testing biological fluids like blood.

140.title: 2 arrested for hitting Delhi Police constable with beer bottle
140.article_body: The Delhi Police informed on Saturday that it has arrested two people, who had allegedly hit a police constable with a beer bottle. The incident had taken place on Thursday, March 10, in the Sarai Rohilla area. The police constable had asked the accused to not play loud music inside a car. Subsequently, they hit him and fled.

141.title: Deepika Padukone criticised for saying she was 'made to feel like a person of colour'
141.article_body: Deepika Padukone's recent Instagram caption, wherein she wrote that she was "made to feel like a person of colour", has been criticised by some social media users. "What does she want to tell? That being called...a person of colour is an insult? And she's a white?" a Twitter user wrote. "The choice of words is so wrong," another comment read.

142.title: Being an MMA professional helps me empower other women: Ritu Phogat
142.article_body: India's mixed martial arts (MMA) fighter Ritu Phogat believes that her profession "helps her in empowering other women". Phogat, who has a 7-2 MMA career record, added, "This is my chance to inspire millions of young girls and women not just in India but across the globe." Phogat left wrestling and took up MMA by joining One Championship in 2019.

143.title: Virat Kohli's 'stunned' reaction after getting out goes viral
143.article_body: Virat Kohli's reaction after getting out for 23(48) against Sri Lanka on first day of Day-Night Test has gone viral. Kohli got LBW out on the bowling of off-spinner Dhananjaya de Silva. The ball spun and stayed low and hit Kohli's pads. After the dismissal, Kohli appeared stunned and stared at the pitch before walking back to the pavilion.

144.title: At times, I was too scared to listen to myself: Elli AvrRam on a decade in India
144.article_body: Actress Elli AvrRam while talking about completing a decade in India said, "The only thing I would have done [differently] is, those few times where I was too scared to listen to my...heart." "Instead, I listened to others' opinions," she said, adding, "Maybe those experiences were needed for me to...learn, that your heart is your right way through life."

145.title: I am very excited for the season: DC's Sarfaraz ahead of IPL 2022
145.article_body: Batter Sarfaraz Khan, who was picked by Delhi Capitals for his base price of ₹20 lakh in IPL mega auction 2022, said he's very excited for upcoming IPL season. "It's because this is my first season for Delhi. I'll try to do well in whatever chances I get for the team," he stated. Sarfaraz has previously represented RCB and PBKS.

146.title: Scientists find new species of giant tortoise on Galapagos Islands
146.article_body: Ecuador's Galapagos National Park on Thursday said scientists found a new species of giant tortoise. The team compared DNA of tortoises that are currently living on Galapagos Islands with bones, shells collected from the species in 1906. They found nearly 8,000 tortoises, previously identified as Chelonoidis chathamensis matched a different lineage which may have belonged to an extinct species.

147.title: Will take in 2,500 Ukrainian refugees from Moldova: German minister
147.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock on Saturday said government will take in 2,500 Ukrainian refugees who had fled to Moldova amid Russia-Ukraine war. Baerbock added that a corridor would be set up through Romania to bring refugees to Germany, primarily by bus. Meanwhile, as per German Interior Ministry, nearly one lakh refugees have so far entered the country.

148.title: We had a long discussion about loss vs NZ before WI match: Mandhana
148.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana who scored 123(119) in the 2022 Women's World Cup match against West Indies, said the team had a "long discussion" about the previous defeat against New Zealand before the match. India Women beat West Indies by 155 runs having been defeated by 62 runs against New Zealand. Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109 runs off 107 balls.

149.title: Maha govt allocates ₹1,500 crore for Pune Ring Road project
149.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and Finance Minister Ajit Pawar on Friday said that the state government has allocated ₹1,500 crore for the acquisition of 1,900 hectares of land for the Pune Ring Road project. He claimed that the project will help divert heavy traffic from entering Pune city. Separately, Pawar announced that Nashik-Pune railway project has been approved by the Centre.

150.title: Needed actor with gravitas, dignity: Bhansali on Ajay in 'Gangubai...'
150.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, speaking about the character Rahim Lala in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said that he needed an actor who exudes a certain gravitas, dignity and strength. "Ajay has all of this. The minute he walks into the film, audiences are with him," Bhansali added. The filmmaker further called the actor a director's delight and a considerate co-star.

151.title: Casting on OTT not based on star power, but on talent: Sanjay Kapoor
151.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor while talking about the casting process said, "It has got nothing to do with star power, but whether you are capable of delivering good." "It feels...good when you sign something on OTT. You know you are not being cast because of a certain value...your talent is enough," the actor added.

152.title: Meezaan Jafri to play lead role in Milap Zaveri's next: Reports
152.article_body: Actor Meezaan Jafri will reportedly star in 'Satyameva Jayate' director Milap Zaveri's next film. "Meezan is really excited to team up with...Milap Zaveri and Nikhil Advani. He loved the script and he will be seen in a never-before-seen avatar," reported Bollywood Hungama quoting a source. He will be seen playing the lead role in the romantic comedy, reports added.

153.title: EU, Turkish diplomats discuss Ukraine at diplomacy forum in Turkey
153.article_body: High Representative of the EU for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Josep Borrell Fontelles and Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu on Saturday discussed the situation in Ukraine at Antalya Diplomacy Forum. This comes after top diplomats from Russia and Ukraine held their first high-level talks on March 10. Meanwhile, UN said it recorded 549 civilian deaths in Ukraine so far.

154.title: Video shows long car queues outside McDonald's in Russia as brand shuts stores
154.article_body: A video showing long queues outside a McDonald's outlet in Moscow has surfaced on social media. McDonald’s has temporarily closed its 847 stores in the country over the Ukraine war. As per the company, the closure will cost it about $50 million a month. Meanwhile, people were also seen selling McDonald's burgers for high prices in Russia online.

155.title: 'Free Guy' director Shawn Levy to helm Ryan Reynolds' 'Deadpool 3'
155.article_body: Canadian filmmaker Shawn Levy has been roped in to direct Ryan Reynolds' third 'Deadpool' movie. Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick, who penned the screenplays for the first two movies, are also returning for the third instalment. Shawn and Ryan worked together in 'Free Guy' and the recently released action-adventure movie 'The Adam Project'.

156.title: Saying 'no war' means wanting Ukraine to give up: Ukrainian tennis player
156.article_body: Reacting to messages calling for 'no war' by tennis players including Russian world number one Daniil Medvedev, Ukrainian tennis player Marta Kostyuk said such messages indicate a desire to see Ukraine giving up. "They are meaningless," added Kostyuk. "It hurts me every time I...see...these Russian players. Their only problem...is not being able to make money transfers," stated Kostyuk.

157.title: Accepting Abramovich despite close links to Putin is our fault: Klopp
157.article_body: Talking about Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said, "It is clear he is pretty close to Vladimir Putin. Everyone knew it but we accepted it. That's our fault." "One man is responsible for [Chelsea's crisis], Putin," added Klopp. Abramovich's assets have been frozen due to sanctions by the UK resulting in financial uncertainty for Chelsea.

158.title: Best time to retire, want to give my place to a youngster: Lakmal
158.article_body: Ahead of his farewell Test match against India on Saturday, Sri Lankan pacer Suranga Lakmal said, "Rather than sticking around... I thought of giving my place to someone younger." In an interview, he stated, "This is the best time to leave". Making his Test debut at Colombo in 2010, the 35-year-old pacer has taken 170 wickets in 69 Test matches.

159.title: Deforestation in Amazon rainforest hit record levels in Feb: Brazil
159.article_body: Brazil's National Institute of Space Research (INPE) on Friday said deforestation levels in Amazon rainforest hit record levels in the month of February. As per INPE, a total of 199 square kilometres were cleared, up 62% from February 2021. INPE added that destruction was three times higher in the first two months than in the same period last year.

160.title: Assailants shoot at Meerut Agriculture university dean, Deoband jail staff
160.article_body: In two separate incidents, unidentified assailants allegedly shot at the dean of Meerut Agriculture University, Prof Rajbeer Singh and three staffers of Deoband jail on Friday. While Singh was shot at in Meerut when he was returning home from the university, the jailer along with two other staffers were shot at when they were at his official residence in Deoband.

161.title: Cardi B shares glimpse of 6-month-old son, says 'That's all you all will get'
161.article_body: American rapper Cardi B has shared a glimpse of her 6-month-old son. She shared the picture after a user tweeted, "Our baby cousin got teeth coming in and we ain't seen him yet." Posting a zoomed-in picture of her son's eye, she wrote, "That's all y'all will get." Cardi B and rapper Offset welcomed their son in September 2021.

162.title: Lot of actors won't do 2 or 3-hero films, I don't get why: Akshay
162.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has stated that there are a lot of actors who won't do a two-hero or three-hero project, adding that he doesn't understand why. "I don't want to take names but...I scratch my head...Doesn't it happen in Hollywood all the time?" the actor added. Akshay further said that if such films work, it works well for everyone.

163.title: Don't know if I replaced anyone in 'The Ghost': Sonal Chauhan
163.article_body: Actress Sonal Chauhan while addressing rumours that she replaced Jacqueline Fernandez in 'The Ghost', said, "I don't know if I replaced anyone." "People explore various options and cast an actor, who suits the script," Sonal added. While talking about Jacqueline, the actress said, "Jacqueline is an achiever...I have great respect for her as an actress."

164.title: Gutted to turn down one of my best chances: Hales on missing IPL 2022
164.article_body: Reacting to his decision to withdraw from IPL 2022 due to bubble fatigue, England batter Alex Hales tweeted, "I am truly gutted to have to turn down one of the best opportunities of my career." "It wouldn't be fair on the team or myself if I wasn't able to perform to the level expected," added Hales in his tweet.

165.title: Secunderabad man loses ₹73 lakh in 2 weeks in cryptocurrency fraud
165.article_body: A Secunderabad-based man lost ₹73 lakh in two weeks in a cryptocurrency fraud, police said. He'd initially invested ₹30 lakh through a mobile application, which later showed that the amount had risen to ₹2.4 crore. He then came across cyber fraudsters who convinced him to invest more money to be eligible to withdraw the profit. Subsequently, he lost the money.

166.title: Harry, Meghan to skip Prince Philip's memorial service in UK: Reports
166.article_body: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will reportedly skip Prince Philip's memorial service to be held on March 29. This comes amid Prince Harry's ongoing legal battle with the UK government to have his security reinstated. The memorial, which will take place at the Westminster Abbey, will allow the public to pay their tributes to the former Duke of Edinburgh.

167.title: I never wanted to shift to Bombay: Manoj Bajpayee
167.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee, while speaking at the Jaipur Literature Festival, revealed that he never wanted to shift to Bombay. "I realised that at the most they can give me a villain's role but at the end, it was all about heroes and celebrating heroes," Manoj added. However, the actor said the pandemic has changed the dynamics of filmmaking.

168.title: JD(U) extends support to BJP in Manipur after winning 6 seats
168.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) on Saturday said it would support BJP in Manipur. "JD(U) would like to appeal to the BJP to honour the mandate reposed in the party," it said. Of the total 60 seats, BJP won 32, one more than the majority mark, while JD(U) won six seats. The six MLAs elected Khumukcham Joykisan Singh as their leader.

169.title: Interest rate on EPF deposits reduced to 8.1% for 2021-22, lowest in 44 years
169.article_body: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has lowered the interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2021-22 to 8.1% from 8.5% in 2020-21. This is the lowest since 1977-78, when the EPF interest rate was 8%. The decision was taken at the 230th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees Employees' Provident Fund.

170.title: Actress Pooja Banerjee, husband Sandeep Sejwal blessed with a baby girl
170.article_body: 'Kumkum Bhagya' actress Pooja Banerjee and her husband, swimmer Sandeep Sejwal, have been blessed with a baby girl. The couple welcomed their daughter on Saturday morning in Mumbai. Pooja's brother Neil Banerjee confirmed the news to ETimes, saying that their family is "extremely thrilled with this new addition". "Baby's father and daadi are by Pooja's side in hospital," he added.

171.title: At least 47 children killed, maimed in Yemen in two months: UNICEF
171.article_body: At least 47 children were reportedly "killed or maimed" in Yemen's civil war in January and February following a surge in violence, Philippe Duamelle, UNICEF Representative to Yemen said. "Since the conflict escalated in Yemen nearly seven years ago, the UN verified that over 10,200 children have been killed or injured. The actual number is likely much higher," Duamelle added.

172.title: Congress Working Committee to meet on Sunday over states' poll results
172.article_body: The Congress Working Committee (CWC) will meet on Sunday at 4 pm to discuss the results of state elections. The meeting will be held at the AICC office in Delhi. Congress failed to retain power in Punjab, won two out of 403 seats in UP, 11 out of 40 seats in Goa and five out of 60 seats in Manipur.

173.title: RBI lifts restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after a year
173.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has lifted restrictions on HDFC Bank's new digital launches after more than a year, the private lender said. These restrictions were imposed in December 2020, due to instances of outages in HDFC's internet banking services. In 2021, the RBI allowed HDFC Bank to issue new credit cards after imposing a ban for eight months.

174.title: Among my top 3 knocks: Smriti on her 123 against WI in Women's WC
174.article_body: India opener Smriti Mandhana, who scored 119-ball 123 against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, said this was among her top three knocks. "After the last game we really wanted to come back strong and considering the situation, I'd rate this knock a bit higher (among her five ODI tons)," she added.
