Smriti was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

175.title: Murray beats Taro Daniel at Indian Wells, registers his 700th career win
175.article_body: Andy Murray defeated Japan's Taro Daniel 1-6, 6-2, 6-4 in the first round of Indian Wells on Friday and registered his 700th career win. With this win, the Briton became the 18th player of the Open era to achieve the feat. "This was a target that I [had] set for myself... last year," Murray said in an on-court interview.

176.title: Talks to revive 2015 Iran nuclear deal paused, says European Union
176.article_body: The talks to revive the 2015 Iran nuclear deal have been paused due to external factors, the European Union (EU) announced on Friday. Negotiators have reached final stages of discussions to restore the deal. Reportedly, the pause is linked to Russia demanding guarantees that sanctions imposed on its economy following its invasion of Ukraine wouldn't affect its trade with Iran.

177.title: Man dies of cardiac arrest a day after undergoing hair transplant in Patna
177.article_body: A Bihar Military Police constable died of a cardiac arrest, a day after he underwent hair transplant in Patna, an official said. "He died due to complications arising from hair transplant treatment. It could be a case of improper treatment leading to reaction of medicines during hair transplant," a doctor said. He had complained of itchy skin soon after transplant.

178.title: Alliance Air flight with 55 passengers overshoots runway in MP, probe launched
178.article_body: An Alliance Air ATR-72 aircraft with 55 passengers on board overshot the runway by 10 metres in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Saturday. The flight had taken off from Delhi at 11.32 am and the airline said all passengers and crew are safe. "We regret the unfortunate incident and have initiated an investigation into the incident," said the airline.

179.title: He used to watch my films 14-15 times: Akshay remembers his late father
179.article_body: Akshay Kumar, during an appearance on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', remembered his late father Hari Om Bhatia and revealed that he used to watch his films "at least 14 to 15 times". "Sometimes, [he'd]...ask his friend, 'What's going on? Let's...watch a movie.' He'd himself buy...tickets...and while watching the film...he'd tap his friend's shoulder and say, 'That's my son'," Akshay added.

180.title: Gifting platform Ferns N Petals raises ₹200 crore from Lighthouse
180.article_body: Online gifting platform Ferns N Petals has raised ₹200 crore from Lighthouse from its Lighthouse India Fund III. Founded in 1994 with a single store in New Delhi, Ferns N Petals reportedly offers 40,000 products including cakes, plants, personalised gifts and experiential gifts, among other things. It also has on-ground operations in the UAE, Singapore and Qatar.

181.title: Faf du Plessis replaces Virat Kohli as RCB captain
181.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) today announced Faf du Plessis as their new captain. The 37-year-old replaces Virat Kohli, who was made RCB's permanent captain in 2013. Du Plessis was bought by RCB for ₹7 crore in the IPL mega auction. Du Plessis has played 100 matches in IPL for Chennai Super Kings and now defunct Rising Pune Supergiant.

182.title: Ukraine Vice PM asks Bill Gates, Microsoft 'to do more to stop war'
182.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has asked Microsoft, its Co-founder Bill Gates, CEO Satya Nadella and Azure "to do more to stop the war". "Thank you for the first steps for peace, but...you have to do more to stop the war," he tweeted. Earlier this month, Microsoft had suspended new sales of its products and services in Russia.

183.title: 22-yr-old man arrested for allegedly raping a 6-yr-old girl in Bareilly
183.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl in Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh. The police raided the accused's hideout on Saturday morning where he fired at the police but got injured in retaliatory firing, a police official said. The accused and the minor lived in the same locality, police said. The crime happened on Friday afternoon.

184.title: Biden nominates Indian-origin Shefali Razdan as US envoy to Netherlands
184.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-origin political activist Shefali Razdan Duggal as his envoy to the Netherlands, the White House announced. "Duggal has served as National Co-Chair of Women for Biden and as a Deputy National Finance Chair at the Democratic National Committee," it added. She is a former Presidential Appointee (President Barack Obama) to US Holocaust Memorial Council.

185.title: Govinda once told me 'You'll become a big heroine': Karisma Kapoor
185.article_body: Actress Karisma Kapoor has revealed that she once waited for actor Govinda backstage during his performance to give him a rose. "When Chi Chi (Govinda) ji met me, he asked, 'Aap heroine banna chahti hain (You want to become a heroine)?' I shyly said yes and he said, 'Aap bahut badi heroine banogi (You'll become a big heroine)'," Karisma said.

186.title: Woman's charred body recovered from Kolkata guest house gutted in fire
186.article_body: The body of a 63-year-old woman from Bangladesh was recovered from a guest house that was gutted in fire at the Free School Street area in Kolkata on Saturday, police said. The fire broke out around 4 am due to a short circuit. The woman, rescued in a charred state was rushed to a hospital but was declared brought dead.

187.title: SHE Teams conduct awareness programme at Hyderabad school
187.article_body: The SHE Teams of Rachakonda Police on Saturday conducted an awareness programme at Krishnaveni Talent School in Turkayamjal, Hyderabad. The programme sensitised children about cyber crimes, human trafficking, child marriages, child labour and community policing among other issues. A similar awareness programme was also organised at Jahangirnagar within the Vanasthalipuram Police Station limits.

188.title: Police catch penguin that escaped from zoo & wandered on street in Hungary
188.article_body: Officers of the Budapest Police headquarters and the civil guards in Hungary spotted a young penguin waddling on the streets, caught it and handed it over to the zoo that it had escaped from. Sharing pictures of the bird, the law enforcement agency jokingly said on Facebook that "it would have been a long walk to Antarctica" for the penguin.

189.title: Shaheen reminds me of Imran Khan, will lead Pakistan soon: Aaqib Javed
189.article_body: Discussing Pakistani pacer Shaheen Afridi, ex-Pakistan pacer and PSL franchise Lahore Qalandars' head coach Aaqib Javed said Shaheen reminds him of 1992 World Cup-winning captain Imran Khan, adding that he will lead Pakistan soon. Lahore Qalandars won PSL 2022 under Shaheen's captaincy to win their maiden PSL trophy. Babar Azam is currently Pakistan's captain across formats.

190.title: Scientists develop early screening tool to detect autism in 1-2 year olds
190.article_body: Australian scientists have developed a screening tool capable of detecting autism in one to two years old toddlers, which is three years earlier than current methods. They studied 13,500 children in five years and found their tool detected autism accurately in 83% of them. This helped in better verbal and overall cognition at school age in such children, researchers said.

191.title: Can we stop judging a woman based on her necklines: Samantha to trolls
191.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu responded to being trolled for her outfit at the Critics' Choice Awards. "Making...judgements about a person simply based on the clothes they wear is quite literally the easiest thing one can do," she wrote on Instagram Stories. "Now that we're in...2022- can we...stop judging a woman based on the hemlines & necklines she adorns?" Samantha added.

192.title: 16% of state budget kept for education: Himachal Minister
192.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Education Minister Govind Singh Thakur said that 16% of the state budget has been allocated for the education sector. Of the Himachal Pradesh's ₹51,365-crore 2022-23 budget, ₹8,412 crore has been earmarked for education, he added. "The state government, during the present academic year, will give smartphones instead of laptops to meritorious children," Thakur further said.

193.title: Man kills friend with hammer, hides his body in house in Ghaziabad; held
193.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 35-year-old friend after hitting on his head with a hammer and then hid his body inside his house in Ghaziabad, police said on Friday. According to police, the accused killed his friend in a fit of anger after they got into an argument. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused, who has confessed to the crime.

194.title: Several injured, vehicles gutted in fire after medical students attack shops in Bihar
194.article_body: Several persons, including three police personnel, were injured and four shops and three vehicles were gutted in fire after a group of medical students of Darbhanga Medical College in Bihar allegedly attacked medical shops in the neighbourhood. The incident took place following an argument between the medicos and a shop owner over some issue on Friday night, police said.

195.title: Elderly couple in Ukraine confront trespassing Russian soldiers, video viral
195.article_body: A video shared by the US Embassy Kyiv showed how an elderly couple stood up to armed Russian soldiers who had broken into their property in Ukraine. The clip showed one of the soldiers firing a shot in the air to scare them away, while they continued to shout at them and managed to get them out of their property.

196.title: Kim posts pics with Pete week after being declared legally single
196.article_body: Television personality Kim Kardashian shared a series of pictures with her boyfriend comedian Pete Davidson on social media, captioning the post, "Whose car are we gonna take?!" This comes a week after a court declared Kim legally single and she dropped the surname 'West' from her social media accounts. Kim and Kanye began dating in 2011 and separated in 2021.

197.title: 70% of Ukraine's Luhansk region now occupied by Russia: Governor
197.article_body: About 70% of Ukraine's Luhansk region is now occupied by the Russian military, Governor of Luhansk Oblast, Serhiy Haidai, said. "The situation is difficult, shelling is ongoing everywhere," he added. Haidai warned people to stay vigilant and not help the invading Russian forces. Haidai said there were no humanitarian corridors for people to safely leave the region in eastern Ukraine.

198.title: Victory margins were less than 5,000 votes in 49 seats in UP polls
198.article_body: The victory margin of 49 candidates was less than 5,000 votes in the recently-concluded Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls, the Election Commission's data showed. As per the data, 25 Samajwadi Party candidates and three RLD candidates lost the poll battle by less than 5,000 votes. From BJP's side, 18 candidates were defeated by less than 5,000 votes.

199.title: UK, EU parallelly probe Google & Meta's 2018 'Jedi Blue' ad deal
199.article_body: The EU and British authorities have launched parallel investigations into a 2018 online display advertising deal between Google and Meta. Both the firms have defended the 'Jedi Blue' deal which the EU said may thwart ad tech rivals and disadvantage publishers in online advertising. Google has been accused of illegally working with Meta to counter 'header bidding'.

200.title: Mumbai Police chief probed by CBI for 6 hrs over Anil Deshmukh case
200.article_body: CBI probed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey in connection with its investigation against former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, officials said. He was examined for nearly six hours over allegations that he tried to influence former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh to withdraw the complaint against Deshmukh while Bombay HC was hearing the case.

201.title: Over 7,000 evacuated from 4 Ukrainian cities on Friday: President
201.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that a total of 7,144 people were evacuated from the Ukrainian cities of Chernihiv, Energodar, Hostomel and Kozarovichi on Friday. Notably, this is in comparison to almost 40,000 people that left a number of cities through humanitarian corridors on Thursday. Zelenskyy accused Russia of refusing to allow people out of the besieged city of Mariupol.

202.title: Under pressure India brought their A game vs giant killers WI in WC: Jaffer
202.article_body: Congratulating India after their 155-run win against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Under pressure against the giant killers West Indies, Team India brought their A game. Well played." India were reduced to 78/3 after 14 overs. Centuries from Smriti Mandhana (123) and Harmanpreet Kaur (109) helped India set a 318-run target for West Indies.

203.title: Pakistan have a weak captain who cannot be aggressive: Danish Kaneria
203.article_body: Talking about Pakistan captain Babar Azam, ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said, "[Pakistan] have a weak captain who cannot be aggressive while leading." Kaneria added that Babar is confused about his team's strength which is why he couldn't guide the curator of the Rawalpindi pitch, used for the first Test against Australia. "[Pakistan were] on the backfoot...the entire Test," stated Kaneria.

204.title: 2 held as B'luru police raid cricket gamblers; ₹2.20 lakh seized
204.article_body: Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru police have conducted a raid on cricket betting gamblers and arrested two persons, who were allegedly involved in gambling, the police said on Saturday. The police added that it has also seized ₹2.20 lakh cash and two mobile phones. This comes as India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test is being held in Bengaluru.

205.title: MVA to hold 'people's civic general body' meet in Pimpri-Chinchwad
205.article_body: Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in Maharashtra, which includes NCP, Shiv Sena and Congress, will hold a 'people's civic general body' meet in Pimpri-Chinchwad on Saturday. MVA is doing so in a protest against BJP refusing to hold a special civic general body meet to discuss budget proposals. BJP "tampered with the draft budget prepared by...civic administration", an NCP spokesperson said.

206.title: 25-yr-old Mumbai man lures 6-yr-old girl with chocolate, rapes her; held
206.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly lured a six-year-old girl with chocolate, took her to his house and raped her in Mumbai. Police said the accused, who was the neighbour of the minor girl, sexually assaulted her multiple times over five days. The incident came to light when the girl complained of pain in her private parts. He has now been arrested.

207.title: Smriti decides to share Player of the Match award with Harmanpreet, interview goes viral
207.article_body: After being named Player of the Match against West Indies in Women's World Cup, centurion Smriti Mandhana decided to share award with fellow centurion Harmanpreet Kaur. Mandhana's interview went viral, wherein she said, "Scoring century and not being...Player of Match is something [a player] wouldn't want." She joked, "I'm sure ICC will...give...another trophy...I'm sure they have enough budget."

208.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi Tech files draft papers for ₹3,350 crore IPO
208.article_body: Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal-led Navi Technologies has filed draft papers with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,350 crore through an initial public offer (IPO), Moneycontrol reported. The offer will primarily consist of fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Sachin Bansal co-founded the financial services company with Ankit Agarwal after exiting Flipkart in 2018.

209.title: 22 injured as BJD MLA rams car into crowd in Odisha; leader assaulted
209.article_body: At least 22 people, including seven police personnel, were injured after Prasant Kumar Jagdev, Biju Janata Dal (BJD) MLA from Odisha's Chilika, allegedly rammed his car into a crowd in Khordha on Saturday. The crowd had gathered outside Banpur Block Development Office for block chairperson election. Jagdev, who was also injured after being assaulted following the incident, is undergoing treatment.

210.title: How does the 2022 Women's World Cup points table read as India jump to top position?
210.article_body: With their second-biggest victory in Women's World Cup history against West Indies, India jumped to the top position on the points table of the 2022 Women's World Cup. The top five teams on the table have four points each. India are on top on the basis of net run-rate. India have a run-rate of +1.333, followed by Australia's +1.061.

211.title: ₹85 lakh cheating case filed against producer Bellamkonda Suresh, son
211.article_body: Telugu producer Bellamkonda Suresh and his son actor Bellamkonda Sai Sreenivas have been booked by Hyderabad police for allegedly cheating a financier of ₹85 lakh. The financier VL Sravan Kumar has claimed that the duo took the money from him in installments in 2018 to make a movie. Kumar further alleged that he was promised credit as an assistant producer.

212.title: Terrific knocks: Tendulkar on Smriti (123), Harmanpreet (109) vs WI in WC
212.article_body: Calling Smriti Mandhana and Harmanpreet Kaur's knocks against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup "terrific", Sachin Tendulkar said the Indian batters made batting look effortless. Smriti scored 119-ball 123, while Harmanpreet hit 109 runs in 107 balls. Notably, the Indian duo's 184-run fourth-wicket partnership against West Indies is the highest for India in Women's World Cup history.

213.title: 19-yr-old jumps off 5th floor of residential society in Gurugram, dies
213.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died by suicide after jumping off the fifth floor of a residential society in Gurugram's Sector 102 on Friday, police said. "The victim's mother and grandmother said that he told them that he was going out to purchase a pen...a few minutes later, he jumped off the balcony on the fifth floor," police added.

214.title: Why is 'Wali', fighting for Ukraine, considered 1 of world's deadliest snipers?
214.article_body: A former Canadian forces' sniper reportedly reached Ukraine to fight Russian forces on March 4 and has killed several soldiers. The 40-year-old, nicknamed 'Wali', is regarded as one of the world's deadliest snipers due to a confirmed kill shot from more than three kilometres away. He had fired a McMillan TAC-50 rifle to shoot an Islamic State militant in Mosul.

215.title: Nepal PM thanks PM Modi for evacuating Nepali nationals from Ukraine
215.article_body: Nepal Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba on Saturday took to Twitter to thank Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the Indian government for the assistance in repatriating Nepali nationals from war-hit Ukraine under 'Operation Ganga'. The Nepal Prime Minister added that four Nepali nationals have arrived in the country from Ukraine via India.

216.title: Delhi CM declares ₹10 lakh aid for families of deceased in Gokulpuri fire
216.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday announced ₹10 lakh aid for families of adults who died in a fire in the Gokulpuri area. "Government will give...₹5 lakh to deceased children's families and ₹25,000 to those whose shanties were burnt," he declared. Saying he was saddened by the incident, he added, "Poor make their shelter after a lot of hard work."

217.title: Don't let violation of privacy turn you into bad person: Jacqueline
217.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has said that the violation of a person's privacy can turn them into a horrible and bitter person. The actress added that it's important not to get upset and turn into a bad person. Jacqueline was earlier questioned by the Enforcement Directorate about her alleged relationship with conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. Her selfies with him had gone viral.

218.title: Fadnavis asked to appear before Mumbai Police in phone tapping case
218.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has been asked to appear before the Mumbai Police in a phone tapping case and transfer of IPS officers. "As the Leader of Opposition, I have the privilege to not reveal where I got the information from...If an offence was falsely registered and if the city police want some help, I will respond," Fadnavis said.

219.title: To resolve complaints of martyrs' kin, ITBP gives out smartphones
219.article_body: In a first, the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) provided smartphones to the families of the martyrs of the force, as part of its grievance redressal system. Ritu Arora, the chairperson of the Himveer Wives Welfare Association (HWWA), said, "Any kinds of complaints can be sent from these smartphones to the digital platform of the grievance redressal mechanism."

220.title: He's Modi ji's son, not mine: Crying father as his son returns from Ukraine
220.article_body: A man named Sanjay Pandita from Srinagar praised the government after his son Dhruv returned from Ukraine's Sumy. A video of the man breaking down in tears surfaced online, wherein he said, "I want to say that it is Modi ji's son who has returned, not my son." "We had no hopes given the circumstances in Sumy," Pandita added.

221.title: This is wrong: Instagram head after Russia decides to block platform
221.article_body: With Russia deciding to ban Instagram over Meta easing its hate speech policy due to the Ukraine war, the head of Instagram called it "wrong". Adam Mosseri tweeted, "This decision will cut 80 million in Russia off from one another, and from the rest of the world as ~80% of people in Russia follow an Instagram account outside their country."

222.title: Mosque sheltering 80 adults and kids attacked by Russian forces in Ukraine
222.article_body: Ukraine's foreign ministry on Saturday said that Russian forces have attacked a mosque in the port city of Mariupol, where more than 80 adults and children, including Turkish citizens, have taken refuge. Ukraine has accused Russia of refusing to allow people out of Mariupol, while Russia blames Ukraine for the failure to evacuate people.

223.title: Man looking for tenant online cheated of ₹4.18 lakh by fraudster in Pune
223.article_body: A man, who was looking for a tenant online for his flat, was allegedly cheated of ₹4.18 lakh by a fraudster in Pune. The fraudster reportedly posed as an Armyman, expressed his desire to rent the flat and subsequently carried out the fraud. Following a complaint by the victim, police registered a case and started an investigation into the matter.

224.title: Mumbai citizens needn't visit police station for passport verification
224.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey tweeted on Saturday that citizens won't be required to visit police stations for passport verification. They will be called only in exceptional cases when the documents are incomplete, he said, adding that they must report if this norm isn't being followed. "Constable who comes to your house does all the work. He's competent," he added.

225.title: Bored Apes maker Yuga Labs acquires CryptoPunks NFT collection
225.article_body: Bored Ape Yacht Club maker Yuga Labs announced it has acquired the rights to the CryptoPunks and Meebits NFT collections from creator Larva Labs. Bored Apes and CryptoPunks are the two highest-value collections by market capitalisation and floor price, according to CoinGecko data. Yuga Labs signaled that they will be giving full commercial rights of the NFTs to individual holders.

226.title: Specially-abled people can also contribute to security sector: PM Modi
226.article_body: Stressing on the importance of technology in the security sector, PM Narendra Modi said that technology has now become a potential weapon in the security apparatus. "Only physical training is not enough to be in security forces," he added. He further said that now specially-abled people can also contribute to the security sector despite not being physically fit.

227.title: Ukraine war at turning point: Zelenskyy as Russian forces regroup near Kyiv
227.article_body: Ukraine war has "already reached a strategic turning point", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said as Russian forces appeared to regroup for a possible assault on Kyiv. "It's impossible to say how many days we still have [ahead of us] to free Ukrainian land. But we can say we will do it...We're already moving towards our goal, our victory," Zelenskyy added.

228.title: Pic shows 'Ghost of Kyiv', Ukraine says he's coming for 'soul of Russian villain'
228.article_body: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine shared a picture of a pilot on Facebook. The pilot is said to be 'Ghost of Kyiv', the Ukrainian pilot assumed to be a myth. "'Hello, Russian villain, I'm flying for your soul!' - the Ghost of Kyiv," the caption read. Reports claimed the pilot shot down at least ten Russian jets.

229.title: World's largest brewer stops sale of Budweiser in Russia, to forfeit JV profits
229.article_body: Anheuser-Busch InBev has asked its partner in Russia, Anadolu Efes, to suspend the sale and production of Budweiser beer in the country. The world's largest brewer said it will also forfeit "all financial benefit from the joint venture operations". The announcement comes after Heineken NV and Carlsberg A/S said they would stop producing and selling their beers in Russia.

230.title: Don't want to play a mother to 40-year-olds anymore: Shefali Shah
230.article_body: Shefali Shah has said she doesn't want to play a mother to "25, 30, or 40-year-olds anymore". "I don't want to look younger than my age...[I've]...children who're 18 and 19, I'm comfortable playing a character like that," she added. The 48-year-old actress played Akshay Kumar's mother in 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' and Ranveer Singh's mother in 'Dil Dhadakne Do'.

231.title: BSP spokespersons will no longer participate in TV debates: Mayawati
231.article_body: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) president Mayawati tweeted on Saturday that all the spokespersons of her party will no longer participate in TV debates. "It's not a secret that during the UP elections, the media, under instructions from their bosses, adopted casteist and hateful attitude towards the Ambedkarite BSP movement," she added. BSP won one seat in the UP Assembly elections.

232.title: Special feeling: Mayank on playing a Test at his home ground in Bengaluru
232.article_body: India opener Mayank Agarwal said it's a "special feeling" to play a Test at home in Bengaluru ahead of India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium. "Not many actually have an opportunity to do so...it feels really nice to be part of the team," he added. Mayank, who was born in Bengaluru, represents Karnataka in the domestic level tournaments.

233.title: Man loses 'lifetime savings' as he cheated of ₹1 crore in Gurugram
233.article_body: A 64-year-old man reportedly lost his "lifetime savings" after being cheated of around ₹1.39 crore in an insurance fraud in Gurugram. Police said the fraudsters allured him, saying that ₹9 crore had got accumulated from the investments he'd made as premiums of life insurance policies. They asked him to pay taxes to receive the amount. Police are investigating the matter.

234.title: ₹250 cr allocated for Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj memorials in Pune
234.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM and Finance Minister Ajit Pawar has announced that the state government will allocate ₹250 crore to build memorials dedicated to Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj in Vadhu Budruk and Tulapur in the Pune district. Separately, Pawar said that the 'Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj Bravery Award' will be launched this year for residents of the state who have shown exemplary bravery.

235.title: Russia seeks more Indian investment in its oil and gas after US ban
235.article_body: Russia's Deputy PM Alexander Novak has said that Russia's oil and petroleum product exports to India have approached $1 billion and added, "We are interested in further attracting Indian investment to the Russian oil and gas sector." This comes days after US President Joe Biden announced ban on all imports of Russian oil and gas amid Russia-Ukraine war.

236.title: Russian tanks were entering Sumy as we were leaving, was like hell: Evacuated Indians
236.article_body: A Mumbai student, who was recently evacuated from Ukraine's Sumy amid war, said, "As we were moving out of Sumy...Russian tanks were entering the city." She said even though Russians said civilians won't be harmed, people were being killed. "We saw destruction all around...The ordinary people are suffering [in Ukraine]. It's like hell," said another student.

237.title: Millions living in polluted sacrifice zones across Earth, warns UN expert
237.article_body: Millions of people across the world are living in "sacrifice zones" suffering from strokes, cancers, respiratory problems and heart disease as a result of extreme pollution in the environment, UN expert, David Boyd warned. These sacrifice zones are places with devastating physical and mental health consequences and human rights violations created as a result of man-made climate crisis, he said.

238.title: 5-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians unveil their new jersey, share pics
238.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians today unveiled their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022, which will begin on March 26. "This is the best MI jersey so far," a fan commented. Earlier today, Delhi Capitals also unveiled their jersey for IPL 2022. Mumbai Indians will face Delhi Capitals in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

239.title: 'Baahubali' changed my life & lives of the people around me: Prabhas
239.article_body: Prabhas said the 'Baahubali' franchise changed his life and the lives of the people around him. "I'm not at all worried about people still calling or referring to Baahubali...If it's still happening even after 10 years, it won't bother me...I'm very proud of it," he added. "It's fine for any actor to be known for a particular film," said Prabhas.

240.title: It's wrong: Prateik on actors being asked to seek permission for intimate scenes
240.article_body: Prateik Babbar has reacted to the recent debate around whether an actor should seek permission from their spouse before working on an intimate scene. He said that maybe a couple can have a conversation about it, but seeking permission is "wrong". The discussion started with the release of 'Gehraiyaan' which featured Deepika Padukone's intimate scenes with Siddhant Chaturvedi.

241.title: Convincing: SRH on India's 155-run win vs West Indies in Women's WC
241.article_body: After India's 155-run win against West Indies in 2022 Women's World Cup, SunRisers Hyderabad tweeted, "A convincing win for Team India." The tweet further read, "A strong batting performance coupled with a team-effort with the ball by...women in blue seals a crucial victory." Smriti Mandhana (123) and Harmanpreet Kaur (109) helped India post 317/8. Sneh Rana took 3 wickets.

242.title: Stop crying like Cong: Sisodia to BJP on delaying Delhi MCD polls
242.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Friday criticised the BJP for delaying the MCD elections and Union Minister Smriti Irani's claim that the national capital's government was withholding MCD funds, saying, "What is this joke?" "Stop crying like Congress...and making childish excuses to run away from...civic polls," he added. MCD doesn't have money as it "indulges in corruption", he alleged.

243.title: Amit Shah flags off Dandi Cycle Yatra in Guj on 92nd Dandi march anniversary
243.article_body: On the occasion of 92nd anniversary of Dandi March, Union Home Minister Amit Shah flagged off 'Dandi Cycle Yatra' on Saturday. Organised by Gujarat Vidyapeeth, the yatra will cover the journey from Kocharab Ashram in Ahmedabad to Dandi in seven days. "The students...will spend the night in seven villages and will have a dialogue on...methods of empowering...rural artisans," Shah tweeted.

244.title: Sunny Leone's work permit for a film cancelled by Bangladesh govt: Report
244.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone's work permit for her Indo-Bangladesh film 'Soldiers' has been cancelled by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting of Bangladesh, as per a report by ETimes. The reason behind this decision is still unknown. However, there are rumours that suggest that some Islamic groups have threatened to stage protests if Sunny Leone enters Bangladesh, reported ETimes.

245.title: Edited video of Paris being bombed, hit by airstrikes shared by Ukraine official
245.article_body: Oleksandr Merezhko, the Chair of the Foreign Affairs Committee in Ukraine, has shared an edited video showing Paris being bombed and hit by airstrikes. "We also thought that it could never happen," Merezhko captioned the video. "Just think if this were to happen in another European capital," the text on the video read, referring to Russian bombing in Kyiv.

246.title: Russia bans Instagram after Meta allows hate speech against Russians
246.article_body: Russia's communications and media regulator Roskomnadzor announced that Instagram will be blocked in the country as the platform is spreading "calls to commit violent acts against Russian citizens, including military personnel." Notably, Meta Platforms has permitted users in some countries to call for violence against Russians and Russian soldiers over the Ukraine war on Facebook and Instagram.

247.title: BJP won due to Hindutva and polarisation: Ashok Gehlot on poll results
247.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that the BJP won in the Assembly polls because they spoke "cleverly" in the name of Hindutva, polarisation. "Everyone knows about the COVID situation in the country and UP. Still, the Opposition lagged behind as they (BJP) speak cleverly. It changed people's minds. I believe truth triumphs in the end," Gehlot added.

248.title: Maha govt announces new 23-km metro line for Pune at a cost of ₹8,313 crore
248.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a new metro line in Pune connecting Hinjewadi's Rajiv Gandhi Infotech Park to Shivajinagar. The 23-kilometre corridor will be the city's third metro line undertaken by Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority. The project is estimated to cost ₹8,313 crore. The state government has allocated ₹1,500 crore for land acquisition for Pune Ring Road project.

249.title: Parliament to resume normal sittings from March 14 with COVID protocols
249.article_body: The Parliament will resume normal sittings for the second part of the Budget Session from March 14 in view of the declining COVID-19 cases. However, the Rajya Sabha and Lok Sabha will continue to follow the COVID protocols, as seen in the earlier parts of the Parliament sessions. House will sit from 11 am-6 pm during the scheduled 19 sittings.

250.title: Don't send your sons to war: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy to Russian mothers
250.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has appealed to "Russian mothers, especially mothers of conscripts" to "not send their children to war in a foreign country". "Check where your son is. And if you have the slightest suspicion that your son could be sent to war against Ukraine, act immediately" to prevent him from being killed or captured, Zelenskyy added.

251.title: Deutsche Bank shuts down business in Russia, a day after its refusal
251.article_body: Deutsche Bank has decided to suspend its operations in Russia over the Ukraine war, a day after it had refused to do so. Stating that there won't be any new business in Russia, Germany's largest bank said, "We're in the process of winding down our remaining business in Russia while we help our non-Russian multinational clients in reducing their operations."

252.title: Over 75% cybercrime cases reported since 2019 remain unsolved in K'taka
252.article_body: As many as 32,286 cybercrime cases have been reported in Karnataka since 2019. Out of this, only 7,835 cases (24%) have been solved by the police so far with over 75% of the cases still pending. Moreover, as per the state government data, convictions were made only in 70 cybercrime cases. The state has 46 cybercrime police stations.

253.title: PM Modi dedicates a building of Rashtriya Raksha University to nation
253.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday dedicated a building of Gandhinagar's Rashtriya Raksha University (RRU) to the nation. PM delivered the university's first convocation address. "It's imperative that police manpower be trained in a way that they're amicable with people," he said. "After independence, recruitment in law and order needed reforms. Unfortunately, we were left behind," PM added.

254.title: Bouncer assaults students' parents at Pune school; video surfaces
254.article_body: A video of a female bouncer purportedly assaulting the parents of students at a school in Pune, who had come there with complaints on fee hike, has surfaced online. According to reports, the school alleged that the parents were getting "unduly aggressive with their demands". One of the parents who was assaulted has reportedly lodged a complaint against the school.

255.title: India to bat first in Day-Night Test against Sri Lanka, playing XIs announced
255.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bat first against Sri Lanka in Day-Night Test in Bengaluru. Axar Patel, who had taken 11 wickets in the Day-Night Test against England last year, has replaced Jayant Yadav in the playing XI. It is India's fourth Day-Night Test. India have won two of their three Day-Night Tests so far.

256.title: Snake, cobra didn't let mongoose win: Swami Maurya on UP poll defeat
256.article_body: BJP turncoat Swami Prasad Maurya said, "Mongoose is always superior to a snake. It is a different matter that snake and cobra together did not let the mongoose win." Maurya had contested from UP's Fazilnagar constituency on a Samajwadi Party ticket after resigning from the BJP in January 2022. However, he lost to a BJP candidate by over 40,000 votes.

257.title: Pic of Buzz Aldrin moonwalk taken by Armstrong sells for ₹5.9 lakh
257.article_body: An original picture of former astronaut Buzz Aldrin's moonwalk during the first manned lunar landing was sold at an auction for around ₹5.9 lakh. A series of 74 privately-owned photographs from Apollo 8-17 missions sold for ₹1.3 crore in the US. Aldrin's picture was taken by late US astronaut Neil Armstrong, whose reflection could be seen on Aldrin's visor.

258.title: Mumbai woman finds husband involved in same-sex relationships, lodges complaint
258.article_body: A 29-year-old woman lodged a case of cheating against her husband after finding out that he was allegedly involved in same-sex relationships. The woman had sent her husband's old phone for examination at a forensic laboratory in Mumbai's BKC after noticing his distant and unusual behaviour during their honeymoon. The laboratory's report hinted that he was into same-sex relationships.

259.title: Samson is as special as Rohit, always been stunned by his batting: Ashwin
259.article_body: Discussing wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson, Ravichandran Ashwin termed Samson to be "equally special" as India captain Rohit Sharma, adding that he has "always" been "stunned" by how Samson bats. "Samson watches a lot of Tamil movies and is a big movie buff, so am I," stated Ashwin. Ashwin will play under Samson for Rajasthan Royals in IPL 2022.

260.title: Sanctions on Russia could cause ISS to crash: Roscosmos chief
260.article_body: Western sanctions against Russia over invasion of Ukraine could cause the International Space Station (ISS) to crash, the head of Russian space agency Roscosmos has said. Calling for the sanctions to be lifted, Dmitry Rogozin said they could disrupt the operation of Russian vessels servicing the ISS. The ISS could "fall down into sea or onto land", he added.

261.title: Crawley-Root's 193-run stand helps England take 153-run lead after Day 4
261.article_body: The unbeaten partnership of 193 runs between Zak Crawley (117*) and Joe Root (84*) has given England a second innings lead of 153 runs at stumps on Day 4 of the Antigua Test against the West Indies. After losing opener Alex Lees (6) early, Crawley and Root piled on the runs which took the visitors' second innings score to 217/1.

262.title: Can't describe Shoaib Akhtar in one word, he's a whole book: Shahid Afridi
262.article_body: Responding to a query about describing ex-Pakistani cricketer Shoaib Akhtar in one word, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said one word is not enough, adding that Akhtar is a "whole book" single-handedly. "I have seen many fast bowlers, but Akhtar's strength and his bravery has wrecked the batters over," added Afridi. "He has achieved great things for Pakistan," stated Afridi.

263.title: Being very late is dangerous: Rashid Latif on Kohli's 'weakness'
263.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif termed Virat Kohli chasing deliveries bowled outside off due to an open stance as his "weakness", adding that it is "dangerous" to be very late with his initial movement. "The opposition has worked on this weakness," stated Latif. "He has to lessen the number of dot balls. Kohli has to be more aggressive," said Latif.

264.title: Actress Sonam Kapoor's father-in-law's firm cheated of ₹27 crore
264.article_body: The Faridabad police has busted a gang of cybercriminals involved in cheating actress Sonam Kapoor's father-in-law's export-import firm of over ₹27 crore. Police said the cybercriminals had been duping the firm by misappropriating Rebate of State and Central Taxes and Levies licences, meant for his firm, on the basis of his forged Digital Signature Certificate and encashing them.

265.title: NMMT to ply only electric buses on weekends in Navi Mumbai
265.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport (NMMT) has decided to ply only electric buses on Saturday and Sunday in the city to reduce fuel consumption as well as to keep the city environment friendly. Currently, NMMT runs a total of 150 electric buses in the city. The zero fuel day will help in reducing the daily operation cost, an official said.

266.title: Squid Game's Anupam shares pics with Will Smith, Selena from SAG Awards
266.article_body: Actor Anupam Tripathi, who was seen in the South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', recently met Will Smith, Andrew Garfield and Selena Gomez at the SAG Awards 2022. He shared pictures of himself with the Hollywood celebrities on his Instagram handle. 'Squid Game' won the award for Outstanding Action Performance by a Stunt Ensemble in a Television Series.

267.title: Ukraine-Russia war to hurt poor nations importing grain: UN
267.article_body: The UN food agency warned that poor nations in Asia, northern Africa, and the Middle East that depend heavily on wheat imports risk suffering significant food insecurity because of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. The war is poised to drive up already soaring food prices, the agency said. Ukraine and Russia account for one-third of global grain exports.

268.title: Hyd man attacks his wife after fight; woman's 2 brothers kill him, his relative
268.article_body: Two brothers have been arrested for allegedly killing their sister's husband and his relative in Hyderabad's Jeedimetla. The incident took place after the woman's husband allegedly attacked her after a fight and she informed her brothers. Based on initial investigation, both the accused were carrying knives and they started attacking their sister's husband after getting into an argument.

269.title: India defeat West Indies by 155 runs as Jhulan Goswami creates Women's World Cup history
269.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 155 runs in their third 2022 Women's World Cup match on Saturday. India put up a total of 317/8, their highest-ever total in a Women's World Cup match. The match witnessed pacer Jhulan Goswami become the highest wicket-taker in Women's World Cup history with 40 wickets. Goswami overtook late Australia spinner Lyn Fullston's 39-wicket tally.

270.title: Pramod Sawant submits resignation to Goa Guv, says will form new govt soon
270.article_body: BJP leader Pramod Sawant on Saturday tendered his resignation as Goa CM to Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai as his first tenure came to an end. BJP is going to form the new government soon, he said. "Governor gave me a letter to be caretaker CM until the process is complete," he added. "BJP will work on...principles of Antyodaya," Sawant stated.

271.title: Absence of proper road makes pregnant woman go to Chhattisgarh from J'khand
271.article_body: A pregnant woman from Jharkhand's Gumla was taken to neighbouring state Chhattisgarh as she was unable to access proper healthcare facilities due to the absence of proper roads. "We called up Jharkhand's helpline number for a pregnant woman but we were told that they won’t be able to help us in the absence of the road," a local said.

272.title: 14-yr-old boy riding a two-wheeler dies in a road accident in Pune
272.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, who was riding a two-wheeler on a public road in Mundhwa, Pune, died in an accident, police stated in FIR on Friday. The deceased lost control of the vehicle and rammed into a tree causing severe injuries to his head and face. Another boy, who was sitting as a pillion rider, also suffered injuries in the mishap.

273.title: How many Day-Night Tests have been played so far and which team has won the most?
273.article_body: A total of 18 Day-Night Test matches have been played so far, with each of the matches producing a result. Australia have played the most number of Day-Night Tests (ten) and have won each of the ten matches. India have played three Day-Night Tests so far, winning against England and Bangladesh, and losing to Australia.

274.title: CJI NV Ramana lays foundation stone for IAMC building in Hyderabad
274.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana, on Saturday, laid the foundation stone for the construction of a new building of the International Arbitration and Mediation Centre (IAMC) in Hyderabad. The centre is currently operating from a temporary campus at Nanakramguda. SC judges Justice L Nageswara Rao, Justice Hima Kohli and state minister KT Rama Rao also attended the ceremony.

275.title: Maximum temperature likely to touch 31°C today in Delhi: IMD
275.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi is forecasted to be around 31°C today, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted. Over the next six days, the maximum temperature is likely to range from 32 to 35°C along with clear skies and strong winds in the capital. Notably, the minimum temperature could range from 16 to 18°C.

276.title: SC appoints former judge AK Sikri as Char Dham panel head
276.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday appointed former SC judge Justice AK Sikri as the head of the Char Dham panel overseeing widening of roads under the ₹12,000 crore project. The court discharged former Chairperson Professor Ravi Chopra after he "expressed the desire to be relinquished from the assignment". Chopra had claimed the road ministry was ignoring the committee's suggestions.

277.title: Turkish journalist jailed for over 2 yrs for insulting Prez Erdogan
277.article_body: Turkish journalist Sedef Kabas has been sentenced to two years and four months in prison for "insulting" President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. She'd been in pre-trial detention since late January for using the proverb "cattle in the palace" against Erdogan on a TV channel and social media. However, Kabas was released from prison on Friday pending an appeal against the verdict.

278.title: Jaffer shares TikToker Khaby's meme to troll Labuschagne over Pakistani daal-roti pic
278.article_body: Wasim Jaffer trolled Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne after he shared a picture of him having 'daal and roti' for lunch in Pakistan. Reacting to Labuschagne dipping roti in daal, Jaffer tweeted a meme of TikToker Khaby Lame, apparently suggesting he shouldn't be dipping roti in daal. Khaby is known for videos wherein he reacts to things that people make complicated.

279.title: Apple, Google sign open letter against 'anti-LGBTQ+ efforts' in Texas
279.article_body: Apple and Google have signed an open letter calling on Texas Governor to "abandon anti-LGBTQ+ efforts to write discrimination into law and policy". The letter ran as a full-page newspaper ad in the Dallas Morning News. "The recent attempt to criminalize a parent for helping their transgender child access medically necessary...healthcare...goes against...values of our companies," the letter reads.

280.title: 15-yr-old gang-raped by 5 men at a hotel in Assam's Guwahati
280.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was gang-raped by five men in Assam's Guwahati, police said on Friday. Two of the five accused sexually assaulted her on February 16, filmed the act and threatened to leak the clip, the minor's mother alleged. On February 19, they invited her to a hotel on pretext of deleting the video and gang-raped her with three others.

281.title: Cab driver threatened to drive vehicle off Mumbai bridge; I begged for life: Actor
281.article_body: A theatre actor has alleged that a Mumbai cab driver threatened to drive the vehicle off a bridge after he asked him to drop him off outside his house, as he was travelling with his sleeping child and had a lot of bags. Marathi actor Pramod Shinde said "We gave him whatever money we had and...begged for our life."

282.title: 14-yr-old boy riding a two-wheeler dies in a road accident in Pune
282.article_body: A 14-year-old boy, who was riding a two-wheeler on a public road in Mundhwa, Pune, died in an accident, police stated in FIR on Friday. The deceased lost control of the vehicle and rammed into a tree causing severe injuries to his head and face. Another boy, who was sitting as a pillion rider, also suffered injuries in the mishap.

283.title: Maharashtra farmers who repay loans timely to get ₹50,000 as incentive
283.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar announced an incentive of ₹50,000 for farmers who repay their crop loans regularly. The scheme could not be implemented earlier due to financial constraints but now it will benefit around 20 lakh farmers, he added. He further announced that the state government has decided to waive ₹964.15 crore loans taken by 34,788 farmers.

284.title: 2 rly officers booked for demanding ₹1.5 lakh bribe in B'luru
284.article_body: Anti-Corruption Bureau has booked an inspector and a constable of the Railway Protection Force for allegedly demanding a ₹1.5 lakh bribe from hospital authorities in Bengaluru. The duo had done so after the hospital reportedly damaged cables in an adjacent railway property. The complainant had recorded the conversation of the duo demanding the bribe on a phone, the police said.

285.title: China approves COVID-19 self-test kits as cases hit two-year high
285.article_body: China on Friday said it would for the first time allow the general public to use COVID-19 antigen self-test kits. People will be able to buy self-test kits in stores and online, the National Health Commission said. This came as China reported over 1,100 new COVID-19 cases on March 11, which is the highest daily count in around two years.

286.title: NIA files supplementary charge-sheet against 2 in Voice of Hind case
286.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) has filed a supplementary charge-sheet against two accused belonging to the proscribed terrorist organisation ISIS in the Voice of Hind case. The two accused are both residents of J&K's Srinagar. A conspiracy was hatched by ISIS to radicalise and recruit impressionable Muslim youth in India to wage violent jihad against India, NIA claimed in the charge-sheet.

287.title: Imbecilic: Simon Jordan on Chelsea fans chanting Abramovich's name
287.article_body: Responding to a query about the chanting of Russian owner Roman Abramovich's name by Chelsea fans, during the period of time for applauding Ukraine, ex-Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan termed it "imbecilic". "We have to call them out for being bloody idiots," added Jordan. "[There is] clear evidence...Abramovich...[is] connected to...Vladimir Putin," stated UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

288.title: I didn't think Tiger Woods and me would be friends: Serena Williams
288.article_body: Talking about golfer Tiger Woods who was recently inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame, former women's world number one tennis player Serena Williams said, "When I first met Tiger, I...didn't think we'd be friends." "I was honestly just in awe of him...like he is Tiger Woods, he was competing against everyone and he looked like me," added Serena.

289.title: Pak fishermen escape on seeing BSF patrol in Gujarat; boat seized
289.article_body: BSF officials have seized a boat from the Sir Creek area near Gujarat's Kachchh after Pakistani fishermen, who'd entered the area illegally, abandoned it there on Friday. The Pakistani fishermen had escaped on seeing BSF patrol by taking advantage of marshy terrain and rough sea weather, BSF said. Fishing net and equipment, eatables and drinking water recovered, BSF added.

290.title: Why did Kohli go on backfoot? He is lacking concentration: Madan Lal
290.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli's dismissal in the first innings of India's opening Test against Sri Lanka, ex-India cricketer Madan Lal said, "Kohli is lacking...concentration. Why did he go on backfoot?" "The more...innings it takes to reach his next hundred, the more the pressure will be on him," added Lal. Kohli hasn't scored an international century since November 2019.

291.title: Hand grenades found in Gurugram house were first spotted by thieves who broke in: Police
291.article_body: Two hand grenades and other ammunition, which were found inside the toilet of a locked house in Gurugram's Sector 31, were first found by two thieves, who broke into the house intending to steal valuables, police said. One of them found the ammunition after going to use the toilet. They were initially scared of informing police, but eventually called them.

292.title: Tripura Oppn allege violence after BJP's victory in 4 states
292.article_body: Tripura Opposition parties have alleged that their party offices and workers have been targeted for political violence after BJP's victory in four states. The state units of CPI (M) and TMC also shared videos and pictures of the violence on their Twitter handles. CPI (M) leader Jitendra Chaudhury called the incidents "undemocratic and fascist" and sought compensation from state CM.

293.title: Delhi Capitals launch their new jersey, share pics
293.article_body: Delhi Capitals launched their new jersey ahead of IPL 2022. "With an equal dash of red and blue, the new jersey exudes youthful and vibrant energy. While...red symbolises the team’s on-field courage, the blue stands for balance and composure," Delhi Capitals said in a statement. "The tiger, an intrinsic part of the DC logo, is bigger and bolder," it added.

294.title: Bhagwant Mann meets Punjab Governor, stakes claim to form next govt in state
294.article_body: Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann met state Governor Banwarilal Purohit at the Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh on Saturday and staked claim to form the next government in the state. Mann said the swearing-in ceremony will be held at Bhagat Singh's native village Khatkar Kalan at 12.30 pm on March 16. "Punjabis from all over the state will come," Mann added.

295.title: India sees lowest one-day rise in COVID cases since May 12, 2020 as 3,614 test positive
295.article_body: India has reported 3,614 new COVID-19 cases and 89 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It is the lowest single-day rise in COVID-19 cases the country has seen since May 12, 2020. India's active caseload stands at 40,559, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,803.

296.title: Rare 250-kg carpenter shark caught in Karnataka, pics surface
296.article_body: A rare and endangered species of sawfish or carpenter shark has been caught off coast in Karnataka's Malpe. The shark weighed around 250 kg. It was caught by a fishermen boat and was shifted from the boat to a truck with the help of crane. It is a protected species in India under Schedule I of Wildlife Protection Act 1972.

297.title: BITS grads-led US-based startup Birdeye raises $60 million
297.article_body: US-based customer experience tech startup Birdeye has raised $60 million in a Series C funding round led by Accel-KKR. Founded by BITS Pilani graduates, Naveen Gupta and Neeraj Gupta, Birdeye claims to help over 80,000 local businesses manage customer experience and interactions. The platform has raised a total of $93 million over three funding rounds to date, as per Crunchbase.

298.title: US imposes sanctions on Putin spokesperson's family
298.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's spokesman Dmitry Peskov's family. Peskov's wife and his children lead "luxurious lifestyles that are incongruous with his civil servant salary and are likely built on the ill-gotten wealth of his connections to Putin", US Treasury Department said. Peskov's daughter Elizaveta Peskova had publicly opposed Russia's attack on Ukraine.

299.title: One of world's best snipers 'Wali' fighting Russian forces in Ukraine
299.article_body: One of the world's best snipers, nicknamed 'Wali', is fighting Russian forces in Ukraine. The French-Canadian computer scientist, who can provide 40 kills in a day, has served twice in the Afghanistan war between 2009 and 2011. He earned the name 'Wali', which means protector in Arabic, during his stint in Afghanistan.

300.title: Russia using unguided 'dumb' bombs in Ukraine: UK
300.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry has said that Russian aircraft supporting ground offensive in Ukraine are primarily using unguided "dumb" bombs. "Such weapons are relatively inaccurate and indiscriminate and their use significantly increases the likelihood of civilian casualties," the ministry added. British Intelligence said Russia carried out strikes on cities of Lutsk and Ivano-Frankivsk.

301.title: Sitharaman stresses on need for multilateral action amid rising global inflation
301.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke to International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva and stressed on the need for multilateral action amid rising prices of commodities due to global supply chain disruptions. According to the Finance Ministry, Sitharaman and Georgieva suggested that the key question remains on the control of inflation while balancing needs for growth.

302.title: I got some criticism: Sai Tamhankar on wearing bikini on screen
302.article_body: Actress Sai Tamhankar has said when she wore a bikini, the Marathi fraternity welcomed the gesture with open arms. "I also got some criticism. Something which I'm comfortable with, my family is comfortable with," she added. "I like characters of all shades. I mean, why portray, only whites, or only blacks, I think our whole life is in-between," Sai said.

303.title: Actress Shama Sikander shares pictures from her bachelorette party
303.article_body: Ahead of her wedding with James Milliron, actress Shama Sikander shared a few pictures from her bachelorette party on her Instagram handle. "Finally getting the Bridal vibes. What a beautiful bachelorette. Thank you all my lovely bridesmaids you all made my day," she wrote. Shama is set to tie the knot with James Milliron in Goa on March 14.

304.title: SC seeks Centre's response on pharmaceutical firms giving freebies
304.article_body: Supreme Court has sought the Centre's response on a plea to regulate pharmaceutical firms bribing doctors with freebies for prescribing their drugs. The advocate who filed the plea said that doctors' licenses are cancelled for such misconduct while it's "actuated, encouraged, aided and abetted" by pharmaceutical firms. The plea has sought that pharmaceutical firms should be held equally liable.

305.title: 2 boys feared drowned in Sutlej river in Himachal's Shimla; search op underway
305.article_body: Two boys, both aged 14, are feared drowned in Sutlej river in the Khaneri area of Himachal Pradesh's Shimla district, officials said. The children were reportedly playing on the banks of the river and had stepped into the river to get their ball back. Police and National Disaster Response Force have launched a search and rescue operation after receiving information.

306.title: Centre introducing regressive ideas in syllabus: MK Stalin
306.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said that the Centre is using its power to introduce "regressive ideas" in the syllabus of universities and this was a "worrisome development". He said that as Education comes under the Concurrent List, the Centre is misusing its power, adding that the best solution for this issue was to restore Education to the State List.

307.title: 1 dead, 1 injured after BMW car hits them in Delhi's Kalayanpuri
307.article_body: Two men were hit by a BMW car in the Kalayanpuri area on Friday night, Delhi Police said. "One was brought dead to the hospital...another was injured...shifted to LBS hospital," police added. An FIR has been filed in the matter, Delhi Police stated. Earlier, two people died after a car rammed into a truck on the Palam flyover in February.

308.title: People caught littering in Chandigarh to be fined up to ₹10,000
308.article_body: People who are found dumping waste in the open in Chandigarh will be fined up to ₹10,000, the municipal corporation said. The corporation has identified 48 garbage vulnerable points across Chandigarh and put up boards warning people. Those found burning garbage and dumping malba at these sites will be fined ₹5,000 each and those found littering will be fined ₹500.

309.title: It was a regular middle-class wedding: Vikrant on marriage with Sheetal
309.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey in an interview opened up about his marriage with actress Sheetal Thakur and said that it was a "regular middle-class wedding". Talking about his life post marriage with Sheetal, the actor said that it has been beautiful so far and he wishes to spend more time with his wife. Vikrant and Sheetal got married on February 18.

310.title: Committed to safety of Bengalureans: Police chief after Namma 112 praised
310.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday thanked a news agency's editor after he tweeted that he can "vouch" for the police helpline Namma 112. "Had a run-in with a bad actor...on airport road...Culprit was detained in under 15 mins," the news agency's editor had said. "Bengaluru City Police is committed to the safety of Namma Bengalureans!" Pant said.

311.title: What are the highest individual scores in Day-Night Test cricket?
311.article_body: Australia's David Warner holds the record for the highest individual score in Day-Night Tests with 335*(418) against Pakistan in Adelaide in 2019. He's followed by Pakistan's Azhar Ali, who scored 302*(469) against West Indies in Dubai in 2016. Ex-England captain Alastair Cook's 243(407) is the third-highest score, while Virat Kohli's 136(194) is the highest Day-Night Test score among Indians.

312.title: Won't tolerate Russophobia: Meta on allowing posts seeking Putin's death
312.article_body: Meta Global Affairs President Nick Clegg in a tweet defended Meta's decision to temporarily lift a ban on posts calling for Russian President Vladimir Putin's death saying, "We have no quarrel with...Russian people...We will not tolerate Russophobia." He said the decision has been taken in "extraordinary" circumstances. Russia has asked for Meta to be designated as an "extremist organisation".

313.title: Delhi HC denies bail to Christian Michel in AgustaWestland scam case
313.article_body: Delhi High Court on Friday denied bail to the alleged middleman Christian Michel James, a British citizen, accused in the AgustaWestland scam case, being probed by CBI and ED. James was extradited from Dubai and was arrested by ED in December 2018. The AgustaWestland scam pertains to corruption and money laundering cases in the procurement of 12 VVIP choppers.

314.title: JeM commander, 3 other terrorists killed in separate encounters in J&K
314.article_body: Four terrorists, including a Jaish-e-Mohammed commander, were killed and one was arrested in separate encounters in J&K, police said on Saturday. The security forces had launched joint operations at four-five locations, IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said. While two Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed in Pulwama, the other two hailing from Lashkar-e-Taiba were killed in Ganderbal and Handwara.

315.title: Harmanpreet Kaur becomes first Indian to smash 3 hundreds in Women's World Cup history
315.article_body: Harmanpreet Kaur has become the first Indian cricketer to smash three hundreds in the history of Women's World Cup. The 33-year-old achieved the feat by scoring 109(107) against West Indies in a 2022 Women's World Cup match today. Harmanpreet's first Women's World Cup hundred (107*) came against England in 2013 and the second (171*) came against Australia in 2017.

316.title: Pune to inaugurate its 6th human milk bank tomorrow
316.article_body: Pune city's 6th human milk bank will be inaugurated at the Bharati Vidyapeeth hospital on Sunday. According to Dr Aarti Kinikar, the milk bank will be useful for newborns admitted to neonatal intensive care units (NICUs) or in cases where mothers die or are unable to lactate. She also claimed, "As neonatal care gets better, the demand will further increase."

317.title: Man's tongue turns black, hairy in Kerala; pics surface
317.article_body: A Kerala man's tongue turned black and hairy after he was put on a pureed diet following a stroke, according to a report published in the JAMA Dermatology journal. Doctors diagnosed him with a medical condition called lingua villosa nigra or black hairy tongue. "The patient and caregivers were given advice regarding proper cleansing measures," the report said.

318.title: Goa TMC leader Mahesh Amonkar resigns, alleges 'lack of support'
318.article_body: Goa TMC's Mahesh S Amonkar resigned from the party alleging "lack of support and negligence from the designated AITC and I-PAC team" during Assembly polls. Amonkar's resignation comes a day after the Goa Assembly poll results were declared in which TMC did not win in any of the 40 seats. Amonkar contested Goa Assembly elections from the Margao constituency.

319.title: Saudi blogger jailed for 'insulting Islam' freed after 10 years
319.article_body: Saudi Arabian blogger Raif Badawi was released on Friday after a decade in prison, his wife said. Badawi, in 2014, was sentenced to 10 years in prison and 1,000 lashes for "insulting Islam" and setting up a liberal online forum. He was publicly flogged in January 2015, receiving 50 lashes, but the rest were suspended after global condemnation.

320.title: Bihar government to provide arms license to every panchayat leader
320.article_body: Bihar Panchayati Raj Minister Samrat Choudhary has said that the state government has decided to provide an arms license to every panchayat leader after many public representatives were killed following the 2021 state panchayat elections. He added that the public representatives must apply for the arms license before the DM, which will then be recommended to the Home Department.

321.title: 2 Indians score hundreds in same Women's World Cup match for the first time
321.article_body: The India-West Indies 2022 Women's World Cup match witnessed two Indian cricketers scoring hundreds in the same Women's World Cup match for the first time. Opener Smriti Mandhana smashed her fifth ODI hundred, scoring 123(119), while Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109(107) in the match. Mandhana and Harmanpreet's centuries helped India put up a total of 317/8.

322.title: India record their highest-ever total in Women's World Cup history, score 317/8
322.article_body: India have recorded their highest-ever total in Women's World Cup history by putting up a total of 317/8 against West Indies on Saturday. India's previous highest total in Women's World Cup was 284/6, which came against West Indies in Mumbai in the 2013 edition. Smriti Mandhana top-scored for India with 123(119) today, while Harmanpreet Kaur scored 109(107).

323.title: Sarpanch shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Kulgam; 3rd such killing in 10 days
323.article_body: Suspected terrorists shot dead sarpanch Shabir Ahmad Mir from Audora in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district on Friday. This is the third such killing in the last 10 days, police said. "The deceased was given accommodation in a secure hotel in Srinagar. He had left the hotel and reached his home without informing the police," Kashmir IGP Vijay Kumar said.

324.title: Rajkot farmer booked for growing 6,800 poppy plants worth ₹4.48 lakh
324.article_body: Rajkot Police booked a farmer for allegedly growing 6,800 poppy plants on the border of his wheat field at Bedla village. The plants weighing 149 kg have a market value of ₹4.48 lakh. "The poppy plants were at the stage of maturity...poppy balls would have been ready for extraction of opium resin in about a month's time," police said.

325.title: DM forms panel to look into last month's alleged gas leak in Noida
325.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar District Magistrate has formed a four-member committee to probe last month's alleged gas leak in Sectors 137, 93, 93B and 128. On the evening of February 24, several residents started complaining of a strong PNG-like gas smell around their homes. The authorities turned up to resolve but there is still no clarity on the matter.

326.title: 17-year-old boy rapes two-year-old neighbour in Mohali, arrested
326.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was arrested for allegedly raping his two-year-old neighbour in Mohali, Sector 82 on Thursday. The toddler's mother had dropped her at the teenager's home to watch cartoons. When she heard her daughter screaming she rushed back to the teen's room and found him sexually assaulting her. She took her to a hospital and informed the police.

327.title: Anupam Kher celebrates his b'day with his 'street friends', shares video
327.article_body: Anupam Kher, who turned 67 on March 7, took to Instagram to share a video where he can be seen celebrating his birthday with his "street friends". "Happy I could celebrate my belated birthday with my street friends #Darshana #Divya and #Yogesh and cut...cake with them. I feel really blessed," he wrote, with the hashtags 'friends' and 'streets of Mumbai'.

328.title: BMC issues attachment notice to Metro One for not paying taxes worth ₹300 cr
328.article_body: The BMC has issued an attachment notice to Mumbai Metro One Private Limited (MMOPL) for non-payment of property taxes worth over ₹300 crore. According to BMC, the Mumbai Metro One, which operates the Versova-Andheri-Ghatkopar Line, has not paid the taxes since 2013. However, MMOPL officials stated that they have been exempted from paying taxes by the Bombay High Court.

329.title: realme announces ₹3000 discount on realme 9 Pro+ 5G
329.article_body: realme expanded its number series portfolio featuring realme 9 Pro+ 5G and 9 Pro 5G. With the 50MP Sony IMX766 camera, epic pictures can be taken in every light and environment, realme said, adding that it is the only OIS in this price segment. It also features light shift design and 5G processors. Customers can avail discounts up to ₹3000.

330.title: Farmer protesting over Chhattisgarh new capital land acquisition dies
330.article_body: A 68-year-old farmer, who was protesting with others affected by land acquisition for Chhattisgarh's new capital city, died on Friday, officials said. "He fainted...was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead," Raipur District Magistrate Saurabh Kumar said. Farmers of 27 villages in Raipur's Nava Raipur Atal Nagar have been protesting to seek adequate rehabilitation and compensation.

331.title: Man approaches Supreme Court accusing wife of cheating, says 'She has a penis'
331.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to examine a man's plea that his wife should be criminally prosecuted for cheating as she has penis. A Supreme Court bench sought a response from the man's wife after the man provided medical report claiming she has a penis and imperforate hymen. "She is a man...It's definitely cheating," the man's lawyer NK Mody said.

332.title: Newsweek editor praises Namma 112; B'luru police chief thanks him
332.article_body:
Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday thanked Newsweek Asia Editor at Large Danish Manzoor after he tweeted that he can "vouch" for the police helpline Namma 112. "Had a run-in with a bad actor...on airport road...Culprit was detained in under 15 mins," Manzoor had said.  
"Bengaluru City Police is committed to the safety of Namma Bengalureans!" Pant also said.

333.title: Mithali Raj breaks world record for captaining in most Women's World Cup matches
333.article_body: India Women skipper Mithali Raj has broken the world record for captaining in most Women's World Cup matches. The ongoing India-West Indies' 2022 Women's World Cup match is Mithali's 24th as captain in Women's World Cup history. She went past former Australia Women captain Belinda Clark, who had captained in 23 matches.

334.title: YouTube blocks Russian state-funded media channels globally
334.article_body: YouTube is blocking access to channels associated with Russian state-funded media globally, days after it blocked channels like RT and Sputnik in Europe. It said it will remove content about Russia's invasion that deny, minimise or trivialise "well-documented violent events". "The blocking by YouTube is nothing but a new turn of an atrocious attack on...freedom of the press," Sputnik said.

335.title: Stalls on road safety, anti-drug awareness opened at Hyd's Numaish exhibition
335.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police has inaugurated various stalls on road safety awareness, SHE teams and anti-drug awareness at the city's iconic exhibition 'Numaish'. "People visiting the exhibition can have a friendly interaction with the staff available at the stalls and educate themselves with traffic rules and road safety," Police Commissioner CV Anand said.

336.title: 55-year-old man killed by elephant near Hasanur in Tamil Nadu
336.article_body: A 55-year-old man was killed by an elephant, which was in search of water, in Tamil Nadu's Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve (STR) on Friday. The person was walking along a stretch of the national highway near Hasanur when the elephant which was crossing the road came hurtling towards the old man and trampled him to death, the Hasanur Police said.

337.title: Grimes dating whistleblower Chelsea Manning after breakup with Elon Musk: Reports
337.article_body: Singer-songwriter Grimes, who recently shared that she has broken up with Tesla CEO Elon Musk, is now dating former US Army intelligence analyst and whistleblower Chelsea Manning, reports said. Earlier, Grimes revealed that she and Musk welcomed their second child via surrogacy in December. Manning was sentenced to 35 years in prison after leaking classified documents to WikiLeaks.

338.title: UN to work on safe corridor for ships stranded by Ukraine conflict
338.article_body: The UN's shipping agency said it'll seek to create a safe maritime corridor to "allow the...evacuation of seafarers, ships from...high-risk and affected areas in the Black Sea and...Sea of Azov". Russia's military took control of waterways on February 24, when it invaded Ukraine. Reportedly, the war has left about 100 foreign-flagged vessels and hundreds of mariners stranded in Ukrainian ports.

339.title: 3 held for hiring labourers who died during manual scavenging in Mumbai
339.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested three people for hiring three men who died while manually scavenging a septic tank of a public toilet in Kandivali. The trio had reportedly entered the tank to check if there was a leak after the residents complained of a foul smell. The accused, however, alleged that they had informed the BMC about the issue.

340.title: Surat farmers protest over land acquisition for railway line from Adani port
340.article_body: Hundreds of farmers gathered to protest against land acquisition for a new broad gauge goods railway track from Adani port to Gothan village and took out a rally in Surat on Friday. They also handed over a memorandum to the district collector stating that farmers of 15 villages in Olpad and Choryasi talukas will lose their lands under the project.

341.title: Centre should not mess with farmers: Meghalaya Governor Malik
341.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has warned the Centre not to "mess with farmers" and advised them to "fulfil all the promises made" to the farming community. "Farmers will get what they want, either through talks or fight. If needed, they will get violent and achieve what they want," said Malik at an event in Jodhpur on Friday.

342.title: Satellite internet sabotage amid Russia's invasion under probe: Report
342.article_body: Analysts from US NSA, the French government's ANSSI, and Ukrainian intelligence are probing a cyberattack that disrupted broadband satellite internet access in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion, Reuters reported. The satellite service started facing issues on February 24 between 5 AM-9 AM as Russia began its invasion. US-based telecommunications firm Viasat owns the affected network.

343.title: 7 die after fire breaks out in 30 shanties of Gokulpuri area in Delhi
343.article_body: At least seven people died after a fire that broke out in 30 shanties of the Gokulpuri area in Delhi, the fire service officials said. "At 1 am there was a fire incident in Gokulpuri PS area. Immediately teams reached the spot with all rescue equipment," police said. "We could douse the fire by around 4 am," police added.

344.title: Country's 1st medical city to come up in 300-acre plot in Pune rural: Ajit Pawar
344.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, while presenting the state Budget, announced the country's first medical city named 'Indrayani Medicity' will be set up in Pune rural for all kinds of specialised treatment under one roof. The state government is hoping to attract investment worth over ₹10,000 crore for this project. The 'Indrayani Medicity' will have about 24 separate hospital buildings.

345.title: Water supply to be hit in Mumbai's Dadar and Worli on March 14-15
345.article_body: Water supply will be disrupted in Mumbai's Dadar and Worli on March 14-15 between 8 am and 2 pm due to repair work on the Tansa East and West main water supply line, the BMC said. According to BMC, there will be 100% water cut in several areas including Worli, Mahalaxmi, Lower Parel, Gokhale Marg.

346.title: Maha-Metro completes metro work crossing rly lines in 5hrs in Pune
346.article_body: Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited (Maha-Metro) on Friday completed an elevated metro corridor work, crossing two railway lines, at Pune's Khadki in five hours. "Central railway had given us time between 11 am and 4 pm...and our team finished the work within deadline,"  Maha-Metro public relations officer said. Maha-Metro has constructed a 79 metre-long girder crossing the railway lines.

347.title: AAP didn't pay ₹13,000 cr to MCD, spends ₹100 cr on ads every month: Gambhir
