347.article_body: BJP's Gautam Gambhir criticised the Arvind Kejriwal-led government by saying that AAP government is not giving ₹13,000 crore to MCD for paying its employees but it spends ₹100 crore every month on party's advertisements. He further said that AAP government is "lying for the last seven years". This comes after Kejriwal alleged that BJP postponed the MCD polls fearing defeat.

348.title: VK Sasikala gets bail in preferential treatment at B'luru jail case
348.article_body: A court in Bengaluru has granted bail to expelled AIADMK leader VK Sasikala and her sister-in-law in a case related to the alleged preferential treatment given to them at the central jail. The duo has been ordered to pay a ₹3 lakh cash bond. Sasikala was accused of getting preferential treatment in a 2017 report by a senior police official.

349.title: UK sanctions 386 Russian lawmakers who supported Putin's invasion
349.article_body: The UK has imposed sanctions on 386 members of Russia's lower house of Parliament who supported President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. The lawmakers in February voted to recognise two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent, providing a pretext for the war, British Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said. The lawmakers will be subjected to a travel ban and asset freeze.

350.title: South Africa's Gibbs was hungover during world record ODI chase against Australia
350.article_body: South Africa's Herschelle Gibbs was hungover when he smashed 175 runs off 111 balls to help his team record the highest successful chase in ODI history against Australia on March 12, 2006. Gibbs admitted in his autobiography that he drank till late in the night prior to the ODI and had a "massive hangover" when he came out to bat.

351.title: Bowler never played an ODI after giving 113 runs in a match
351.article_body: Australia's Mick Lewis never played international cricket again after leaking record 113 runs in the ODI against South Africa on March 12, 2006. Playing just his seventh ODI, the pacer registered figures of 10-0-113-0 as South Africa scored 438 to record the highest-ever successful ODI chase. Herschelle Gibbs, who scored 175 in the match, was dropped twice on Lewis' bowling.

352.title: 4 men rob Iraqi couple of ₹2.44 lakh needed for surgery in Gurugram
352.article_body: Police booked four men for robbing a couple from Iraq of ₹2.44 lakh that they had brought to India for surgery in Gurugram. The suspects posed as policemen and robbed them on the pretext of checking their travel documents on Thursday, police said. The woman came to India with her husband on March 6 to undergo liver surgery, police added.

353.title: Man pretending to be Swiggy delivery boy enters house, robs family in Thane
353.article_body: A man, allegedly pretending to be a delivery boy from Swiggy, entered a house in Thane, robbed the family of valuables worth ₹10.20 lakh and threatened a 15-year-old with a knife. The accused had asked for water from the woman, who hadn't ordered any food. Police said the accused escaped with gold and diamond jewellery, cash and a mobile phone.

354.title: 400-plus target has been chased successfully only once in ODI cricket's 51-year history
354.article_body: A 400-plus target has been successfully chased only once in 4,364 men's ODIs and 51 years of ODI cricket. South Africa achieved it by chasing down Australia's 434, the first-ever 400-plus men's ODI total, at Johannesburg on March 12, 2006. The match witnessed 87 fours and 26 sixes, with both teams scoring combined 872, highest match aggregate in ODI history.

355.title: Besieged Mariupol now the worst humanitarian catastrophe: Ukraine Foreign Minister
355.article_body: Sharing a picture of a mass grave, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted, "Besieged Mariupol is now worst humanitarian catastrophe on the planet." He added, "1,582 dead civilians in 12 days, even buried in mass graves like this one." Kuleba stated, "Unable to defeat Ukrainian Army...Putin bombs the unarmed, blocks humanitarian aid. We need planes to stop Russian war crimes!"

356.title: Russian soldiers kidnap Ukrainian mayor; video surfaces
356.article_body: The mayor of southern Ukraine's Melitopol was kidnapped on Friday by Russian soldiers occupying the city, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and officials said. "A group of 10 occupiers kidnapped the mayor of Melitopol Ivan Fedorov," Ukraine's Parliament said on Twitter. "This is obviously a sign of weakness of the invaders," Zelenskyy said, comparing Russian soldiers with ISIS terrorists.

357.title: Kejriwal-led Delhi govt deprived MCDs of ₹13,000 crore: Smriti Irani
357.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani said that the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government in Delhi deprived the Municipal Corporations of Delhi (MCDs) of ₹13,000 crore as funds. "Kejriwal himself had stopped the funds for sanitation workers," she added. "He goes to such depths...he even stops fund flow for maintenance of parks in the national capital," Irani stated.

358.title: New batch for online MBA, BCOM & BBA starting soon at Manipal University
358.article_body: NAAC A+ accredited Manipal University Jaipur has announced that the new batches of its UGC-entitled online degrees like MBA, BCOM, BBA, BCA & more are starting soon. It invites students to get a degree while working or pursuing other commitments and benefit from offerings like scholarships, vast alumni network, free access to Coursera & additional professional certification courses worth ₹50,000.

359.title: UK millionaire blocks street with his Bentleys to prevent demolition of luxury complex
359.article_body: A millionaire used his Bentleys and other luxury cars to block the street leading to 'UK’s biggest man cave' to prevent it from getting demolished. Graham Wildin has been involved in a legal battle after he built a luxury complex behind his house equipped with a bowling alley, cinema, squash court and private casino in 2014 without gaining proper permission.

360.title: 30-yr-old software engineer dies on spot as truck hits him in Pune
360.article_body: A 30-year-old software engineer died on the spot after a speeding truck mowed down the bike he was riding on the stretch on Wednesday morning in Pune. The deceased man was going towards his workplace on a motorcycle when the truck dashed him near the Punjab National Bank branch in Undri, police said. Meanwhile, police have arrested the truck driver.

361.title: Man forces wife to drink phenyl for refusing to divorce; held near Mumbai
361.article_body: A man has been arrested from Panvel near Mumbai for attempting to kill his 35-year-old wife. The man was reportedly having an extramarital affair and was seeking a divorce, which his wife kept refusing. On Tuesday, he and his relatives tried to convince the woman to divorce him. However, when she didn't agree, the accused forced her to drink phenyl.

362.title: Crocodile caught & paraded by locals in MP, video goes viral
362.article_body: A crocodile that had reportedly entered a village in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri on Thursday night was caught, tied with a rope and paraded by a few youths, a video of which went viral on social media. The reptile was later put in a water tank on instructions of the village elderly before being rescued by a forest department team.

363.title: UP man held over objectionable remarks against PM Modi, CM Yogi
363.article_body: A man who was allegedly seen making objectionable remarks against PM Narendra Modi and UP CM Yogi Adityanath in a viral video during election campaigning was arrested by UP Police on Friday. He has been identified as Ajay Yadav from Azamgarh. A case under provisions of the IT Act and CLA Act has been registered against him.

364.title: Blessed to play impactful characters: Radhika Madan on upcoming projects
364.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan said she feels blessed to be playing 'impactful and important' characters in her upcoming projects. While talking about the women-driven stories that she is currently working on, the actress said, "Each role celebrates a different story of a woman." Radhika is currently working on National award-winning filmmaker Sudhanshu Saria's film 'Sanaa'.

365.title: Largest food company Nestlé stops exports of non-essential items to Russia
365.article_body: World's largest food company Nestlé has stopped exporting and importing non-essential food items from and to Russia. The company will still supply Russians with necessities such as baby food, cereal and therapeutic pet food sold at veterinarian clinics. "We are shocked and deeply saddened by the invasion of Ukraine...[It] has brought heartbreaking, unimaginable human suffering," the company said.

366.title: Kidambi loses, Lakshya enters semi-finals at German Open 2022
366.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen entered semi-finals of 2022 German Open after defeating compatriot HS Prannoy 21-15, 21-16 in men's singles quarter-finals on Friday at Westenergie Sporthalle. In other quarter-finals match, top-seeded Viktor Axelsen beat eighth-seeded Kidambi Srikanth of India 21-10, 23-21. Lakshya will now face Axelsen in semi-finals on Saturday.

367.title: Seized vehicles gutted as fire breaks out at K'taka police station
367.article_body: A fire broke out in the parking space of Kengeri Police Station in Karnataka's Bengaluru at around 1.30 pm on Friday, police said. "The compound wall adjoining [the] railway track also caught fire. Around 12 vehicles, involved in rioting, theft and robbery cases were damaged in the incident," DCP West Bengaluru, Sanjeev Patil, said. The fire was doused later.

368.title: 10-yr-old raped by father allowed to end pregnancy, HC says 'society must be ashamed'
368.article_body: The Kerala High Court has allowed the termination of the around 31-week-long pregnancy of a 10-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her father. The petition was moved by the minor's mother. "If the allegation is correct, I am ashamed and of course, the entire society should bow their head for the same reason," said the High Court judge.

369.title: 36-yr-old Gabriel Boric sworn in as Chile's youngest President
369.article_body: Gabriel Boric was sworn in as Chile's youngest President on Friday, with delegations from the US, Spain, Argentina, Peru and others in attendance. Boric's female-majority Cabinet was also sworn in today. An economic slowdown, high inflation and a split legislature are among the challenges that the 36-year-old faces, according to Reuters.

370.title: NFT of clipart rock worth $1 million mistakenly sold by owner for under $0.1
370.article_body: A non-fungible token (NFT) of a clipart rock was sold for less than $0.1 after its owner mistakenly listed it for 444 wei instead of 444 ETH. "In one click my entire net worth of ~$1 million...gone," the owner tweeted, claiming that a bot "sniped" the NFT. Wei is the smallest denomination of Ether, the currency used on Ethereum network.

371.title: Fugitive accused of killing tigress, panther arrested in Rajasthan
371.article_body: A fugitive sought in cases related to wildlife offences was arrested from Rajasthan’s Dausa district by the CBI. The accused, who was absconding since 2008, had killed a male panther in Alwar in 2003 and a tigress in Sariska in 2004 and sold their skins for ₹1800 and ₹50,000 respectively, according to CBI. His accomplice was convicted in 2019.

372.title: Russia fired at Belarus from Ukrainian airspace to drag it into war: Ukraine
372.article_body: Ukraine's armed forces said that Russian aircraft fired at a Belarusian settlement near the border from Ukrainian air space on Friday to try to drag Belarus into Moscow's war on Ukraine. Ukraine said that Russian aircraft had taken off from an airfield in Belarus, crossed into Ukrainian airspace and then fired at the village of Kopani.

373.title: Cong will be reduced to small geographical area by 2026: Assam CM
373.article_body: Commenting on Congress' performance in five states that went to Assembly polls, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday said that the party will be reduced to a "small geographical area" by 2026. "People have rejected Congress as an alternative to...BJP," he added. "The party has now been limited to a level of a regional party," he further said.

374.title: 5 killed, 2 injured after car crashes into tree in Karnataka
374.article_body: Five people from Maharashtra were killed and two others were injured after the car they were travelling in crashed into a tree near a village in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district. The injured have been shifted to hospital, police said. The victims had been returning from the Dattatreya temple in Ganagapur when the incident took place, police added.

375.title: IPL franchise Gujarat Titans to launch team jersey on Sunday
375.article_body: Gujarat Titans, who will make their debut in IPL 2022, announced that they will be hosting their inaugural event on Sunday in which they will be launching the team jersey. Gujarat Titans squad will have a pre-season camp at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad before the start of IPL 2022.

376.title: New govt in Manipur will be formed before March 19: CM
376.article_body: Outgoing Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the new government in Manipur will be formed before March 19 when the current state assembly term ends. Singh has resigned from the post and has been asked to continue as caretaker CM by Governor La Ganesan. The BJP won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur.

377.title: Bhopal prof, accused of sexually harassing girls, quits after ruckus
377.article_body: Professor Tapan R Mohanty of Bhopal's National Law Institute University resigned on Thursday amid allegations that he sent vulgar messages to female students. Several students had gheraoed his office demanding his resignation. "From the past two years, we conducted online classes so how can I harass them," Mohanty asked. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan ordered an inquiry into the matter.

378.title: What is the Most Favoured Nation status that US, allies want to revoke for Russia?
378.article_body: The World Trade Organization's 164 members commit to treating each other equally in order to benefit from the lowest tariffs, few trade barriers, among other things. This principle of non-discrimination is known as the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) treatment. By revoking Russia’s MFN status, Western allies can levy whatever import tariffs, quotas on Russian goods or even ban them.

379.title: Huma prepped for Gangubai Kathiawadi song at night amid Maharani shoot
379.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, who made a special appearance in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' in the song 'Shikayat', did the prepping and rehearsals for the song at night. She was busy during the day shooting for her web show 'Maharani' at the time. "I enjoyed the whole process and the vision Sanjay (Leela Bhansali) sir had for the song," Huma said.

380.title: Gave Shafali a break because she was out of form: Ramesh Powar
380.article_body: Ramesh Powar, coach of India women's cricket team, revealed the reason for dropping opening batter Shafali Verma in the World Cup match against New Zealand on Thursday. Powar said that Verma was "given a break since the opener was out of form". Left-handed batter Yastika Bhatia replaced her in the match, which India lost by 62 runs.

381.title: Direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3: Biden
381.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday said that "direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3". [It's] something we must strive to prevent," he added. "We'll defend every single inch of NATO territory. We'll not fight a war against Russia in Ukraine," said Biden. "Putin's war against Ukraine will never be a victory," he stated.

382.title: Russian shelling killed at least 1,582 in Ukraine's Mariupol: Report
382.article_body: City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Friday said at least 1,582 civilians were killed due to Russian shelling and a blockade which lasted for 12 days. This comes as several civilian facilities including a children's hospital were destroyed by Russian forces in Mariupol since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

383.title: Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of Punjab's people: Kejriwal
383.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that he's sure that Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of the people of Punjab as the CM of the state. Notably, Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann met Kejriwal in Delhi today, a day after AAP won Assembly elections in Punjab. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

384.title: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang says he will step down next March
384.article_body: China's Premier Li Keqiang on Friday said that he plans to step down after his current term expires next March. Li is number two in the hierarchy of ruling Communist Party's Politburo Standing Committee. Reportedly, President Xi Jinping is expected to secure a precedent-breaking third term as party chief at a party meeting to elect leaders for next five years.

385.title: Can't wait for tomorrow: Kohli shares net session pics ahead of 2nd Test
385.article_body: Ahead of India's second and final Test against Sri Lanka, Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share a few pictures from his practice session in Bengaluru. "Back to Bengaluru. Can't wait for tomorrow," he captioned the pictures. The ex-India captain recently played in his 100th Test in Mohali. He has scored 8,007 runs in Tests so far.

386.title: SP leader Yogesh Verma who guarded EVM room using binoculars loses
386.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Yogesh Verma, who was seen guarding an EVM room using binoculars, lost on Thursday from Hastinapur in UP. The seat was won by BJP's Dinesh by 7,312 votes. Notably, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had levelled EVM tampering allegations and even said the machines were being transported without informing candidates. SP bagged 111 out of 403 Assembly seats.

387.title: Turkey moves its embassy from Kyiv to Chernivtsi: State media
387.article_body: Turkish Foreign Ministry spokesperson Tanju Bilgiç on Friday said Turkey has moved its embassy from Ukrainian capital Kyiv to Chernivtsi amid reports of a planned attack on the capital city by the Russian forces, reported state media. A country sharing maritime borders with Russia as well as Ukraine, Turkey was among the last countries to operate diplomatic missions in Ukraine.

388.title: US bans import of Russian vodka, seafood & diamond; downgrades Russia's trade status
388.article_body: US President Joe Biden announced on Friday that along with the European Union and the Group of Seven countries, the US will move to revoke "most favoured nation" trade status for Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. "We're also taking further steps, banning imports of goods from several signature sectors of Russian economy, including seafood, vodka and diamonds," he added.

389.title: Aaron Finch joins his 9th IPL team, replaces KKR's ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales
389.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has become the first cricketer to have been part of nine IPL teams. The 35-year-old has joined KKR for ₹1.5 crore as a replacement for their ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales, who has withdrawn from IPL 2022 due to bubble fatigue. Finch has played for RR, DC, PWI, SRH, MI, GL, PBKS and RCB in IPL.

390.title: Ukraine urges Israel to send military weapons and sanction Russia
390.article_body: Ukrainian ambassador to Israel, Yevgen Korniychuk on Friday urged Israel's government to enhance its support for Ukraine by sanctioning Russia and sending defence equipment. "What we expect from Israel at the moment... is to join the sanctions of their allies, including but not only the US and EU," he added. Kornyichuk also urged Israel to accept more refugees without limitations.

391.title: Plant 75 trees in each village to mark 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav': PM
391.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said that each village should create a small forest by planting 75 trees during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75 years of India's Independence. There should be at least 75 farmers in each village who adopt natural way of farming, he added. PM Modi made the comments during his address at Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan in Ahmedabad.

392.title: Pakistan inducts made-in-China J-10C fighter jets to counter India's Rafale jets
392.article_body: Pakistan has formally inducted China-made multirole J-10C fighter jets into its air force. "Unfortunately, efforts are being made to create an imbalance in the region and to address this, a big addition has been made today to our defence system," Imran Khan said. Last year, Pakistan's Interior Minister said the jets were acquired to "counter India's purchase of Rafale aircraft".

393.title: Russian forces have caused $100 billion in damage so far: Ukrainian official
393.article_body: The invading Russian forces have so far cost damage of at least $100 billion to infrastructure and other physical assets, said Oleg Ustenko, economic advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He added that the war has caused 50% of Ukrainian businesses to shut down completely, while the other half are operating well below their capacity.

394.title: 25-year-old man dies of alleged drug overdose in Punjab's Bathinda
394.article_body: A 25-year-old man died of an alleged drug overdose in Punjab’s Bathinda on Friday. The victim who worked in Rajasthan had allegedly arranged the drugs after returning to his village on Thursday, according to a Bhartiya Kisan Union-Ugrahan leader. The drug availability "is a serious challenge before the AAP government," the leader added while demanding immediate steps to control it.

395.title: Malinga named RR's fast bowling coach, Paddy Upton returns as 'Team Catalyst'
395.article_body: RR have appointed Lasith Malinga as their fast bowling coach ahead of IPL 2022. Malinga, who retired as a player in 2021, is the highest wicket-taker in IPL. "It's a wonderful feeling for me to return to IPL and an absolute honour to join RR," Malinga said. Further, Paddy Upton, who has worked for RR before, returns as 'Team Catalyst'.

396.title: 3 dead, 2 injured after truck hits parked vehicles on MP highway
396.article_body: Three people were killed and two injured after a truck collided with two parked vehicles, a tanker and a pick-up van, on Rewa-Prayagraj National Highway in Madhya Pradesh on Friday. The victims were pulled out of the vehicles with help of locals, police said. The injured were rushed to a hospital, while the bodies were sent for post-mortem, police added.

397.title: Jussie Smollett given 150 days in jail over staged hate crime case
397.article_body: Actor Jussie Smollett, who portrayed Jamal Lyon in drama series 'Empire', has been sentenced to 150 days in jail for staging a hate crime. Jussie had alleged that he was attacked by two men who yelled racist and homophobic slurs at him. He has also been ordered to pay $120,106 (₹91 lakh) in restitution and a $25,000 (₹19 lakh) fine.

398.title: Man hangs himself in TN after wife breaks phone suspecting affair
398.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after his wife broke his mobile while accusing him of having an affair with a woman. His wife, who had returned after spending six months at her native place, found him constantly messaging and speaking on phone, which led to an altercation, police said. She later found him hanging from ceiling.

399.title: Japanese schools ban ponytails fearing they might 'sexually excite' boys
399.article_body: Japanese schools have banned female students from wearing their hair in ponytails because the nape of their necks could "sexually excite" male students. "They are worried boys will look at girls," said a former middle school teacher. This is the same reasoning applied by schools while enforcing the white-only underwear rule for students, the ex-teacher said.

400.title: Singer Millind Gaba to marry longtime girlfriend on April 16
400.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend of four years social media influencer Pria Beniwal on April 16. The festivities will begin on April 11 with the couple's sagan ceremony. The wedding is expected to be a traditional ceremony with Punjabi rituals along with  Haryanvi Jat rituals.

401.title: When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things: GT's Gurkeerat
401.article_body: On getting opportunity to play for Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, batter Gurkeerat Mann said he's excited as the franchise showed faith in him. "When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things," he added. Gurkeerat was picked by Gujarat Titans for ₹50 lakh in mega auction 2022. He last played an IPL game in 2020 edition.
